sequence: Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce, direct, finance and/or star in their own films who might otherwise not have been able to? Is that a good thing? This film does not answer the latter question either way, but it does appear that without Curb, Jeff Garlin would not have been able to make I Want Someone to Eat Cheese With. Like most new producers/directors, Jeff Garlin's independent piece heaves a heavily more sensitive sigh than the vehicle he is primarily known for (Curb).

So it's not an award winner, so what? Have you ever wanted to see a film that was just silly? "The Villain" and this one could top the list.My husband says that "Jekyll and Hyde Together Again" is one of those movies that if "you've been there and done that" you'll think this spoof on the 80's cocaine culture is a riot. I think the whole film is just fun. Nothing is sacred; hospitals, plastic surgery, Howard Hughes.... There are ongoing gags that you have to watch for to appreciate.

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining. It provides updates of tech news, video games pretty much everything geek. They are also the official broadcasters of E3 and Comiccon. If you are a geek, gamers or anything really, you will enjoy this show. They have definitely upped their game since the guy below me's review (2006). It's the only place that I get my tech info. Kevin Pereira and Olivia Munn work beautifully with each other and the show always has segments referring to things in the game, movie, comic... Universe.

My college theater just had a special screening last night of this film. I have got to say that I think everyone was impressed with how good this movie was. Though, my roommate didn't care for it but he's not into horror movies anyway and just went to see if Paris Hilton can act. By the way, if you're worried about that, don't be. I'm not exactly one of her fans, but I must be honest and say she was pretty good and she has the best death scene. Overall, all the actor's were very good.

The cover of the VHS says it all: "Without doubt, the most powerful movie of its kind since the Texas Chainsaw Massacre". I'm a huge fan of 70's and 80's slashers and I have to say, I agree 100 %. The characters are believable, the actors have an excellent charm (especially George Kennedy as the forest-ranger). There's the twisted atmosphere, that only TCM has, an astounding soundtrack to reflect the emotions and the filming locations that are the most beautiful in the history of horror.

`` Blind Spot '' one of my festival favorites . I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers coming together for one night and each with their own agenda . The film is very well cast and the directing and pacing of the film kept me riveted to my seat . It is one of those films where the characters are so well written and so well directed , you don't know which character is the bad guy till the very end . I loved it and would not be surprised to see it nominated for the Oscars in the future .

Containing Billy's famous humor, this more modest comedy with heavy bittersweet overtones is a big departure, pleasantly unexpectedly so for Billy Crystal. This movie has different tear-jerker, dramatic, serious underlying themes (particularly with a scene with Steven Seagal). This movie was both entertaining and serious, a movie about lost love, about relationships with father-son, husband-wife, about friendship and values with a good dose of humor thrown in, especially at the beginning. The balance between drama and comedy isn't always maintained as with the new classical genre of this type, but the real message and motivation for this movie remains solid.

Even after nearly 20 years apart , the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing . In fact , the chemistry is stronger than ever before . Their last tour with Heaven and Hell was a great success and the band seemed to gain more and more fans every stop . Now that they’ve been on the road again for two years , it’s no wonder that the shows have gotten even better . When the band returned home from their Ozzfest dates last fall , they recorded their first live album in many , many years and now it has finally been released .

This is a well directed Columbo episode , with also some good character but the story just does n't really work , the culprit just did n't made sense and also there was an important plot element that just don 't make any sense at all . This is really the only bad episode in the 3rd season
The plot of this episode is simply bizarre, and so much of it can't even be explained. It doesn't seem to be made clear when and if the car that was blown up was actually used as the murder weapon.

This movie is great I really enjoyed it.This movie is about a cat mom named Dutchess and her 3 kittens.T Dutchess and the kittens love music.They have to practice the piano everyday.But the butler named Edgar tries to kidnap Dutchess and her kittens he tries to make them sleep. But he fails. Them Dutchess meets a cat named Thomas O Maily. Thomas falls in love with Dutchess. The cats break into song. With the song everybody wants to be a cat. Thomas gets to love music like the other cats. Thomas and Dutchess really like each other.I loved this movie and i like the cats to!

Pity the Monkees . People always accused them of being manufactured ( which they were ) or being nothing more than pretty boys who played the guitar ( well, yes, some of the time ) . But as you can tell by this album , they had some great music inside them. "Different" is the best word to describe the album, but not in the negative way it's normally used . This is a good thing . The songs on "Changes" really were different , in a positive , good way. There wasn't really any songs on here that could be considered fillers .

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in the days of apartheid. It shows how this hate was contrived and was groomed from generation to generation. Jan Ellis was taught that a black man was a plague. He was raised to be that way. Then he meets a man who is on the opposite side of his beliefs, Pastor Lekota. will he change his ways?. The film is a powerful movie that shows the perceptions the different races had for one another, it shows these perceptions with quite a lot of accuracy.

Accepted is a 2006 teen flick that stars the guy from the mac and PC ads. The movie is about Bartelby .B. Gaines a guy who has rejected from all the colleges he has applied for so decides to make his own college and invites all the other people who did not make it, problem is hundreds of people sign up to his school. The movie is hilarious and I was lucky enough to buy it for $5.00 at a sale and I have always watched it since. Overall this movie is a must watch for fans of all comedy as it is funny, witty and just a good movie all up.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie. I am not saying this lightly. I love movies and am fairly picky about them (my home DVD collection is over 9,000 movies - some are great, others are OK, a few I do not like at all). And, to all those with criticisms: this is a comedy. I simply love this movie. It is light, funny, and very restful. I am aware of all (or most) of the deficiencies but I love it.

Films belonging to the `` film noir '' genre usually contain similar elements : a `` deus ex machina '' that comes at the end, a dark atmosphere with heavy shadows and rain, a first person narrative, a fatalistic view of life and a very bleak view on the world. Films in this genre are often set in the American underground after the Second World War or in the present time. However, there are two sub-genres within film noir, one set before the Second World War, and one set after, with the former being more traditional and the latter more experimental.

I never thought I'd say this about a biopic, but there is a near over-abundance of characterization (especially concerning Kenji Miyazawa's emotions) and too little on the literal occurrences in his life--by the end, I'm not sure if he dies (he's supposed to), or if his sister finally dies (she's supposed to), or if the director spent a little too much time on the Galactic Railroad (that's an inside joke, in case you missed it--Miyazawa wrote a children's book called Night on the Galactic Railroad).

Made at the height of the Black Power movement , this movie portrays African-American Putney Swope ( Arnold Johnson ) who takes over his own ad agency. There is little plot to speak of so I won’t get into that too much. However, this movie is very important because it is one of the few examples of African-American films that were made during this time. Most films with all African-Americans did not exist. This is one of a very few that did exist. In fact, this movie is so unique that it can hardly be classed as a “black” movie.

Right this may be the wine talking but this could be the best movie I 've seen in a very long time. This movie had it all. Action, humor, drama. It didn't over do the comedy and didn't do too little of it. Everything seemed to mesh perfectly. I never felt like anything was out of place or over done. This movie has a lot to be proud of and they did a great job in my opinion. I've been to many a Marvel movie and have been mostly disappointed but this one was definitely not.

Accepted is one of the best teenage comedies I have seen in a long time . It has an original plot and it makes you want to rewatch it over and over again to catch the jokes you missed before . It’s a great movie that is worth your time and attention . Friday, November 16th, 2018 at 2:01 am and is filed under Movie Reviews. In this movie, a teenager who was not accepted by the high school, is invited to be a part of a group who are not allowed to sit in the school.

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films , it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment . The only survivors of a pandemic that has erased all human life live in a subway that is their refuge. The script is based on a 1976 short film that I’m not sure who did. The movie takes the premise and turns it into an examination of human relationships. There are very strong performances, especially from Robert John Burke, James Murtaugh, who is a blind man, and Jennifer Tung, who is a pregnant woman. Suspense builds over the 100 minutes but there is no payoff.

Too bad somebody did not have the smarts to release this movie to theaters . I had never heard of this movie until this DVD and after watching it , I really felt it is a good movie and would do well at theaters if it had gotten a release . If you have not heard of this film , do not let that deter you . If you have , I highly recommend it as it is a good movie and well worth watching . It will be in theaters shortly so be sure to put this one on your " Must See In The Theaters " list .

I 've read a lot of reviews about Showtime on IMDb and many seem to miss the mark . I think that the critics are reviewing the old show, but it has been revamped. I was not sure what to expect but it was good. I don't want to ruin it for you so I'm not giving away any major plot points. What I can say is that there are some good laugh out loud parts in it. I am a big comic book, sci fi, action film fan and I really enjoyed the show.

Considering all of the comedies with a military situation that have been done in history, someone had to be the first. One could make a case that in Shoulder Arms, Charlie Chaplin invented the genre.Hard to believe that back then this was a daring move. When you consider that some of the best films involving such people as Bob Hope, Abbott&Costello, Laurel&Hardy involved military service and made during war time, it's just something you accept and laugh at.In the First World War Chaplin along with fellow stars Douglas Fairbanks and Mary Pickford went out on bond tours.

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year . You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime, and 5 or 6 at any given time on the Encore channel. But it is hard to keep up with these stories. I don’t know whether I am a true-crime junkie or not, but I’ve read and seen at least 2 dozen books and stories on JonBenet Ramsay, the murder of Lacy Peterson, Amanda Knox and the rest. The most recent of these was 2007’s An Unbelievable Story of Rape.

This is probably the second best of the Death Wish movies . Death Wish 5 is the best one.Death Wish 4 was not bad. Death Wish 2 was just terrible. Death Wish 3 is in the middle. I enjoyed it , because it has Bronson who is the main character in these movies , and he is one of the best action stars ever.He is very good at kicking the bad guy's butts. The bad guy's in this are no match for Bronson and they know it.They know they can't kill him. I liked it because it had lots of action and a pretty good story.

Another go round with the monkey king going west....sort of.Beginning in the middle of some action the movie just goes from the first frame onward.A monk and his three disciples go to a town to get the sacred suras that will bring peace to the world once they are translated and spoken to the world.But an evil force has intervened and kidnapped all of the children of the town. The evil force wants the monk because if you eat him you will live forever. The retainers battle the forces of darkness before forcibly sending the monk off for safety (The monk thinks he can win simply by reasoning with the bad guys).

`` Pearl Harbor , buddy . '' This movie is brilliant ! Sure it does n't exactly flow like an epic story, but it is one of the most realistic war movies I 've ever seen ( I 've seen a few ) . Even the acting was great ! As far as the story goes , well , there was really no story , just an action movie with little plot . But , as a movie , it is brilliant ! If I had to rate this movie I 'd give it about 4 or 4.5 stars .

This movie is truly a classic 80s movie! A must have in any '80s' movie collection! Guns, Bad Guys, CREEPS, Gangs, CHARLES BRONSON and more CREEPS!!!! In my opinion, this is the best Death Wish movie. Tons of non-stop action! And keeping with the classic 80's "bad guy vs good guy" movie - this movie is about anything but the norm and all about guns and CREEPS! We see Bronson mowing down thugs and CREEPS with a 30 caliber Korean War heavy machine gun! A HEAVY MACHINE GUN FOR CRYING OUT LOUD!

Spike Milligan 's books and plays have defeated film makers over the years , and 2002 's 'Puckoon ' is one of the latest failures. It was written by the comedian and is based on his 1963 masterpiece novel. "Puckoon is one of the best novels of its decade. It is unclassifiable, utterly brilliant, and should be made into a movie by someone with imagination, taste, wit, and a passion to bring it to the screen. "- John Kennedy Toole, A Confederacy of Dunces author. "It is a brilliant satirical novel and deserving of film treatment.

Hey all you jive hustlers , you stone foxes , you mean dudes . Watch out cause Slaughter is back and this time he means business ! I just bought a 2006 Honda Shadow Aero and I love the way it drives , handles and feels but there is one nagging thing I am starting to hear after a few miles of riding that bothers me. Its a rattling sound that changes in pitch depending on how you are riding but seems to be the loudest when in a slow steady cruise. I cant seem to figure out the exact source of the sound .

This musical has a deep meaning which is appreciated by only a few. The wise can see the wisdom contained in what most call folly.This music may well regain popularity as world consciousness rises. It is about a land "far away from it all" where "living things have room to grow." Its people are "living and growing together" mentally and spiritually faster than in biological age.The lyrics help us recognize the relativity of this "world that is spinning around" and to "look inside yourself; that is where the Truth always lies."

A labor of love . Each frame is picture perfect and grabs you . Then the sheer emotion and story-telling of each frame just captures you in a way that most books don’t even come close to . You feel for the protagonists , the story and the events that unfold in a way like you have not felt for a book for ages . You will feel like you were right there with them at that time , living that life of that era , going through the trials and tribulations that life brought for them and the way that they fought for what they felt was their destiny .

Then again , I like Rachael Ray . She is fun , sweet , fresh , and such a joy to listen to . She makes cooking seem so easy . I can't believe I'm actually going to attempt to cook one of her recipes tonight , it's a good thing the recipe is on-line and I can get the recipe from here if I can't follow it . LOL . I just have to see if all the ingredients we have in our pantry , I think I may be good to go . I've never actually watched any episodes of her shows but I do love her .

I taped The Morrison Murders on Lifetime Movie network and I watched The Morrison Murders on Lifetime , Lifetime Movie Network
I don't know why it's a Lifetime movie. That would be a good question for Lifetime. It was probably a movie on a cable movie channel and Lifetime bought it to air on LMN. LMN doesn't air original movies, it's a Lifetime property that airs films that were originally made for TV movies or cable movies. I was just wondering about the filming. If it was made in 2005, how was it aired, if not on TV?

Being American, I have not been exposed to this character before, which is good because some of you have been disappointed. I have nothing to compare it to. I have found no enjoyment in the mindless idiot humor in the American teen movies, and although this is a slightly similar type of humor, I couldn't stop laughing. I hardly ever laugh out loud at a movie. And usually a movie has a few funny parts for me, but this movie was funny from start to finish. My only disappointment was when it was over.

Motorama viewers should already by keen on other offbeat b-grade desert-based films such as Bagdad Cafe or Repo Man (which more or less takes place in the desert). It also models some of the bizarre humor (and especially eccentric trail of characters) of writer Joseph Minion's comedy, 'After Hours.' In a sort of desert roadtrip fantasy, a metaphor of temptation and redemption, Gus (played well by Jordan Christopher Michael), a clever 10 year-old boy cashes in his piggy bank, steals a Mustang, and runs away from his grossly neglecting parents.

David Attenborough brings his fascination of wild life, this time the creatures under the sea, in this extraordinary 8-episode trip to all the animals under the sea!The cinematography is astounding, bringing to the screen truly breathtaking footage of those whales! But the best thing about it, as well as seeing each episode, is how they made it! Whether it is making models of creatures, or those impressive shots of the whales, they explain to you in about 10 minutes how they did it!2001 had some great tv shows to our screen.

When the trailer for Accepted first came up , many people began to get excited about seeing it ... really, how could they not? When a trailer for a movie comes up, many people begin to wonder about the quality of it. There's been so many bad movies lately that when a good movie comes around, people want to see it ... and they'll put out a lot of money for it. I have to admit, the first time I saw a commercial for Accepted, I was like, "I'm seeing this."

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency. Putney Swope is on the board for no other reason than the fact that he is black, and the agency needs a "token" on the board. Swope is ignoring the meeting, reading Jet magazine at the big table, and everybody is ignoring Swope... Suddenly, the CEO croaks on the spot. No time is wasted. A janitor is called to haul off the corpse, and the board immediately and unceremoniously tackles the business of electing a new CEO.

Accepted is one of the best teenage comedies I have seen in a long time. It has an original script, talented cast and it delivers an hour and a half of pure unadulterated fun.It tells the story of a high school graduate Bartleby "B" Gains (Justin Long) who is not accepted in any of the collages he applied to, so to avoid his parents' disappointment he creates a fictional collage. In the attempt to fool his parents completely he creates a fake website and turns an old psychiatric hospital into a school.

This is NOT the masterpiece that is Snow White , Cinderella , or Bambi , but it IS a very entertaining and enjoyable movie that is sure to make your little girls (and big ones, too) squeal with delight! It’s a story of three little kittens, Pouncival, Tom Thumb, and Peek a Boo, who are lost and searching for their lost mother. They eventually find her and learn the meaning of the word ‘teamwork’. They also make a new friend – a dog named Squeek. But Squeek isn’t your average dog.

Although this film never attained commercial notoriety , my experience has led me to conclude that many well-done pieces of cinema go unnoticed for reasons other than content. In fact, some are overshadowed by a combination of untimely release and/or inadequate distribution. In 2000, this was such a film. Although released in mid-June, by the time it reached my area, it had already closed. And this film deserved a much better run. It was that good. I did not read the novella prior to this film, and so was going in blind.

I saw a sneak preview of this Tuesday night with a group of friends and we had a blast ! There were 5 of us and we all enjoyed it immensely. There is action and lots of it. There is a good plot. There are some good laughs. Oh and did I say there is a ton of action? Chris Pine looks good in anything so I guess it's OK that he is shirtless a few times. I've read reviews saying the film is predictable. If that bothers you, go see another movie. Really, how many ways can they tell a story anyway?

The Paul Kersey of DEATH WISH 3 is very far removed from the Paul Kersey of the original film . The original Paul Kersey was a quiet man who was forced to become an urban warrior against crime after his house was broken into while his wife was brutally raped and murdered in front of him. Kersey himself was brutally attacked with a fire poker to the head, which knocked him unconscious, and then he was forced to clean up the mess left by the perps. He had to do it because he was in no shape to clean up his own home.

As an English teacher, I appreciate films that do more than tell a story. Good films, like good literature, cause one to think, reflect and predict. This film made me do all three. Mr. Jansen takes risks and uses foreshadowing, symbolism and interesting turning points for many of his characters. I also likes the fact that despite the choices the characters make in the film, their choices do not seem as adolescent or felonious as other films I have seen. The acting is pretty good and the actors seem to share a good chemistry with each other.

I saw this movie on late night TV out of Buffalo about 30 years ago and I'm dying to see it again one more time before I... well.. you know. The interaction between the main characters after the Tiger (Eli Wallach) "captures" his prey (Anne Jackson) in a botched kidnapping attempt is absolutely hilarious. Charles Nelson Reilly's portrayal of a neurotic university dean(?) or department head is priceless. How many films can you name which are able to illuminate humanity's struggle for meaning and fulfillment by making you laugh from beginning to end?

I don't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor. You need to get your head out of your up-tight ass if you don't find this movie hilarious! If this isn't your "cup of tea", so to speak, then look at it for what it truly is- a damn funny movie. Maybe they DID set out to make yet another drugs/T&A movie, but in this case, they've truly hit the spot. It's especially funny for the Ali G fans, because he delivers everything we've come to love and expect from him.

There 's no point in comparing this with the original series . Though different in look and content , both are very good anime for the younger kids . It has always been an interesting story. I would highly recommend this if you like fantasy shows or if you've read the book. The story is great. The characters are memorable. The animation and sound quality are top notch and the show is an overall great piece of entertainment! This is amazing. The story is excellent. The art is brilliant. The soundtrack and music are superb.

Duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner's mansion in Paris. When the evil butler hears that the rich old lady is leaving everything in her will to the cats first, the butler is angered, because he wants to get everything first. So he puts them to sleep and abandons them off the side of the road. When the cats wake up, they start on a long trek home. A street wise cat named Thomas O'Malley meets up with them and offers to help them.

It 's Showtime ! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro 's careers . It 's also a comedy film that is so bad that it actually hurts one 's ears to listen to it. This film was made to make money from two superstars, it was an easy task. The story is about the two superstars and they play in the showbiz. So basically, it 's like a documentary about two guys trying to make money off their fame and popularity. Robert and Eddie play themselves and the movie starts off as a sitcom and then they take the viewers on the show.

You know , people who make comedies so often forget it 's really ok to be outrageous . Well , I don't think this film is ever really outrageous but it is very funny and it takes the viewer on a ride where you never know what to expect. It has a few scenes that may be overly violent for some , but nothing really shocking. And , I think this is the perfect comedy for people who have little time and want a film that will entertain and make them laugh. So , watch this one , have a great time and enjoy .

When I saw this film at a festival years ago I was very impressed and I started to looking for it. Nothing to do, not in the cinemas, nor on DVD neither on Blue ray. Absolutely nothing!!! How it's possible this could really happen??? The direction is IMPECCABLE, the story is intriguing and has been filmed in a very original way the music it's perfect and James Franco is hot as hell!! !Please release this master piece and allow it to have it's proper life!!!!!!!!!!

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback, and if anyone is confused about her past (like how did she end up in the same hospital Hurley was in) then you should know that despited Libby dying in season 2, the character will be explored more in season 3 and we will get answers to questions surrounding her.BTW, great episode. It had a really great cliffhanger and some interesting questions...like what happened to Eko and Lock and what about the four toe statue?I cannot wait till season 3, Lost just rules!!!

I still ca n't describe what to feel when I received this by the fnac site . Such a rare book and I was one of the first who bought one. I will keep it for ever. The quality of this book is so amazing that you can't stop staring to the images. 100 pages of pure inspiration, I could have spent hours and hours with my eyes closed in front of such a beautiful piece of work. It's a book for those who love fashion and art and it's for sure one of the best books I've bought recently.

Oh I remember watching this show at 4:00 p.m. during my junior high days . It was not a pleasant memory to have . I was a 7th grader ( 1974), and was in a new school in the city of Miami . It was the first time ever I ever saw such a violent television show . This show was one of my favorites back then. I was a kid and I remember watching this show when it was on and loving it. After the show was cancelled I didn’t see any episodes for a while and then I did, I think they had it on USA.

Film auteur Stephan Woloszczuk explores the depths of love, passion, and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss in his latest film BLINDSPOT.BLINDSPOT'S diegetic world is exploding with suspense and takes the audience on a twisting  journey to the core of the human soul. As a director, he manages to draw the human spirit from the performances of his actors. With superb editing, especially in the flashback scenes and beautiful cinematography, BLINDSPOT is a thought provoking suspense from beginning to end. A thriller which leaves much to the minds' eye.What an  astounding accomplishment for Stephan Woloszczuk. Cheers Stephan!

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar ! The film took a while to pick up from the first 45 minutes, it was slow moving, but after that, it was a fast moving and funny show. Jim Carrey is great in the movie, he portrays himself as well as the character he was given. Steve Carrels is also good in the role, and has a great chemistry with Jim. I would have to say the best acting of the show came from Steve Carrels. The movie wasn't too special effects oriented, but it had its share.

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development. Fulci was a master at creating horrific atmosphere using inventive camera work, vivid cinematography, and yes - wonderfully explicit gore.This film is no exception, however, compared to his later films (The Beyond, Zombie 2, City of the Living Dead, House by the Cemetery, etc.) the characters here are extremely well developed and the emphasis shies away from the supernatural and is more on the suspense created by a classic who-dunnit amongst the lush hills of Italy.

What can I say about the series dubbed the NEW OUTER LIMITS ... Hmm .... Only that this was one of my all time favorites as a kid, and I still watch these episodes as an adult. This show is a great example of why I like Sci-fi, great story, great effects. It has been shown in re-runs for years on many cable channels. One of my fondest memories was watching reruns with my Dad, he is a fan of sci-fi and horror and I think he was the reason I became such a fan.

Not a stunner, but a good movie to see once or twice. Bill Macy shows he can do more than just act; his writing was pretty darn good. Great supporting cast, especially Jamie Cromwell as the extortionist private eye.The movie's greatest strength is the work of Macy, who reminds us of his Jerry Lundergaard role from Fargo. He has numerous scenes where he is extremely funny as a slimy, manipulating and deceitful character. It's enjoyable to watch him be a weasel, and for a while I was happy that things were turning out well for him.

This is one of those films where it is easy to see how some people would n't like it . It is not an action adventure movie. There is no gun play . No sword fights . It is just very well written and performed by some of the greats in cinema. If you 'd like to know what I thought , click here. Jeffrey R. Houpt December 29, 2014 at 12:31 PM
That was a great review and thank you for sharing. The 1959 is a classic for me as well. The story is timeless, and the acting is simply superlative.

When I first saw this movie,I also expected "our boys" to be cute,and more like an extended version of the TV show. I didn't "get it" back then. But,years later,at a party YEARS later,at a 70s' type PAR-TAY,where certain substances had been smoked,inhaled,and with plenty of tequila,"HEAD" was on late at night.We watched it,and finally realized what "HEAD" was all about. It spoofed their own show,as shown in one song that called themselves,"a manufactured image".

This is Christmas time ! A nativity in terms of rebirth , or at least this is what can be expected. Christmas time ! A nativity in terms of rebirth, or at least that is what we expect. As it is written, every end is a new beginning. We can never forget those who have passed away, and to whom this is not a beginning. There is a saying, we do not die but only leave. It is not a beginning as such but only a continuation. It is in a way like going to another level, another state, another dimension, another life.

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film (which is excellent). It borrows the main premise--a man has been poisoned and spends the rest of the film trying to find his killer. But I like that the writers chose an English professor, instead of a private dick, as the protagonist. The plot is also quite original. In general, the film moves along fast enough to keep you awake. But what mars this film is a strange dated quality about it (probably due to the horrendous 80's original music score)combined with an affected "noir" feel.

"Blind Spot" one of my festival favorites. I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers searching for a mysterious man who has loved and betrayed each of them in different ways. The cast is great. James Franco is particularly amazing as the broken-hearted boy from Los Angeles. His journal entries, which we hear in voice-over-narration, work well with the visuals and are quite intense. The film has a powerful style. It pushes elements like the road movie and revenge-drama in new directions. It also plays with time and perspective in ways that capture the frightening ambiance of lost love.

Film auteur Stephan Woloszczuk explores the depths of love , passion , and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss. Based on the classic novel written by Henry De Vere Stacpoole. Sailing is a way of life. This is about the passion of sailing in all its glory, the thrill of being at the helm, the joy of the company of good friends and family on a day of sunny fun, sailing together, and sailing on. This is also about loss, the heartbreak and the struggle when a great love is gone.

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you'll be hard-pressed. HEAD is a masterpiece of non-linear non-structure, surrealism and experimentaion. In less than 90 minutes, it manages to be not only a time-capsule of an era, but also a full-length experimental feature that defies time,space and convention in a way that only underground films of the sixties could.HEAD is a reflection of those films. No matter how one feels about the Monkees, this is a film every filmmaker should see because it cracks wide open the endless possibilities of film as an art medium.

This little film is hysterical , full of stereotypes about gays , straights , dwarfs , British tea and pubs. Honestly I can't say whether it was meant to be funny or offensive but I thought it was the funniest thing I've seen in quite some time! Either way you will laugh at it and if you don't there is definitely something wrong with you! BTW if anyone wants to see more British comedy , I'd be happy to oblige...just ask. I laughed a lot at this, but it was mostly out of pity for the guys who had to play the dwarfs.

After a somewhat slow start I thought this movie about the Italian occupation of a Greek island during World War II picked up and became a quite enjoyable watch for a couple of hours, from primarily two points of view. The love triangle is an interesting one and strikes me as believable, because I know it happened in various places under occupation. Penelope Cruz played Pelagia, a young Greek girl engaged to be married to Mandras (Christian Bale). I had questions about the depth of their love from the start, but their future was torn apart when Italy invaded Greece, and Mandras went off to fight.

Better than it has any right to be , this movie died a quick and painful death at the American box office, despite the fact that it is the funniest movie of the year so far, and a lot better than other films that made more money, and that were more hyped. The movie is basically a one-liner machine, like a Marx Brothers film, or maybe Airplane , in that it relies on gag after gag instead of a continuous plot, and in the end I found myself just laughing my ass off. The plot is essentially a retread of "Airplane!

If we could have "Separate Tables," why not "Separate Lies. "This becomes somewhat involved. A housekeeper's husband is killed when he is hit by a car while on a bicycle. The culprit turns out to be the woman she cleans for. The latter was having an affair with a friend and was driving the car with the lover in it when the accident occurred. To complicate matters further, the housekeeper once worked for the guy's parents and he had her jailed for stealing. Therefore, people will hesitate to believe that it was his car that caused the accident.

People comparing this movie to big blockbusters like Lord of the Rings or the Matrix will inevitably be disappointed with the low-key approach of the Wizard of Oz, but it's a classic nonetheless, and has all the components necessary for a good film: a strong story, great performances, beautiful visuals, and memorable music. It's still a joy to experience. The Wizard of Oz won't impress anyone who's not familiar with this 1939 classic, but it will delight them and remind them why this is such an important movie.

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson's work, and for about as long as I've known his name, I've also looked for this movie. I tried looking for this movie all over California for over four years. this past summer i took a trip to Europe, one of my missions on this trip was to at least see this movie. long story short, I bought it and watched it in France! I was blown away, it completely made my trip and i finally feel content that i have seen Luc Besson's first work.

I admit to being in awe of the Sea and have spent a number of years in the Navy , which meant that I got to travel round the World. I am proud to have been in the RN at a particular time when many of my friends were conscripted to the Army, which was a most unpleasant experience. I am now semi retired and spend the time working in the garden , which in turn gives me more time to spend on my painting. I am also a keen amateur photographer , which provides inspiration for painting.

I Loved this movie . Mark Blankfield was perfect for this role . More Classic sci/fie/Horror films should be remade with Blankfield in the role . This movie is way better than the original. The actors were able to make the characters feel real, and you could relate to the characters, which was a major factor in me liking it more. It's a good movie; it just pales in comparison to the 1984 version, which is still one of my absolute favorite movies. This remake did not have any of the fear or the anticipation, the terror or the suspense of the original 1955 version.

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage 's better films . He turns a fine performance as the wartorn Captain Antonio Corelli who occupies a small Greek Island with his regiment during the early days of the 2nd World War. As a means of keeping the peace between two feuding families, he offers his services by playing his mandolin to them at the family's taverna. It is here he comes across the beautiful Pelagia and the two become infatuated with each other. However, Corelli is in love with Melina, one of the daughters from the opposing families who is to marry the local doctor.

This is sweet . The actress who played the nurse with the gonzongas is the same actress who plays Elvira on the Fright Nights episode. She's very hot in both roles. I've been searching for a copy of this one for ages! Now that I've seen a few screen shots from it, I'm really going to have a hard time not downloading this one. What a great show you guys run. Keep it up. Nice episode, but I agree with a previous poster who mentioned it was missing something. There is something about this series that makes it a little less than perfect.

Years ago when I first read John Irving 's The World According to Garp , I was astounded that most folks had no clue that the storyline was based upon a real event. The story revolved around a writer of female centric romance novels and his mother. The mother, who is a nurse, is accidentally shot and killed as she was performing her duties in a local Emergency Room; thus the story of the writer and his love of women begins. I have to say that when the news first hit me that Jodi Arias has been found guilty on all charges against her I was a bit disappointed.

I first saw The Victim (aka Out Of Contention) well over 25 years ago when I was very young. Being a passionate fan of Bewitched since I was a child, I loved to watch anything that starred Elizabeth Montgomery. This movie was (and still is) a real treat - whether you are a fan of Miss Montgomery's work or not. Elizabeth always shines in her roles, such as her portrayal as the rape victim in A Case Of Rape and as the suspected murderess in The Legend Of Lizzie Borden.

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen : much better and deeper than Luhrman’s The Great Gatsby, which I thought it was going to be amazing, but ended being very shallow and empty. Snowqueen takes the fairytale about the boy Kay from Hans Christian Andersen and shows it from the perspective of Gerda, who is a child when we first see her and grows up as the story unfolds. The little boy Kay, her best friend, is kidnapped and Gerda goes on a quest to save him, which turns out not to be so easy.

Let's be fair: there are no RULES for scriptwriting, so I won't say the movie SHOULD be something other than it is. I'll just state my opinion. OK, I really liked the script, the way things are told and characters are introduced. However, I think when a play is adapted to the silver screen, it could maybe try and fit this other media. Since this movie was directed by João Falcão, the same man who directed the play, it's not too much of a surprise that the film turned out a bit too theatrical.

Frank Langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in! I love watching him!! i was 10 yrs old (1979) when i seen him for the first time.i eagerly await each and everything he'll be acting in. hopefully one day i can see him in person. he's very hypnotic and mysterious and that voice is commanding and strong! he is very attractive, even now at 65 he is absolutely stunning!!!! In my opinion he is the greatest actor iv'e ever seen!

I think it definitely is. The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language should model their conversations after its dialogue. For example, the exchange between Paul Kersey(Bronson) and Ms. Kathryn Davis(Deborah Raffin) (more about this character later) is extremely clear and to the point: Ms. Davis says, "I hope you like chicken. It's the only thing I know how to make," to which Kersey deftly responds, "Chicken's good. I like chicken."

I think that this short TV series , was absolutely wonderful , and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation as to what was happening in the lives of the characters , and of course the ending was excellent ! It also showed a lot of what happens behind the scenes of a police station ! It really was an excellent production ! I do hope that there is a series two in the making , as it would be a real pity to loose this excellent cast ! I just saw this show on Amazon Prime for free and thought it was awesome. The acting was superb.

What a great film! I never knew much about Buddy Holly, but was familiar with his lively and fun music. This is a wonderful biography of someone who helped change the music in the 1950's. Although I never cared for Gary Bussey, he was fabulous as Buddy Holly! I don't know how accurate the movie is, but assume at least for the most part it is accurate, which makes the movie all the more interesting. The music throughout the movie just adds the pizazz to this biography. I don't think I would change a thing in this film, it was all good!

Although this film never attained commercial notoriety, my experience has led me to conclude that many well-done pieces of artistic expression often do not gain mass appeal. The story line depicts a young boy stealing a car and embarking on a surreal, dream-like adventure with very little basis in our conceptualization of time and space. Therefore, anyone who attempts to view this film from the perspective of its conformity to reality will likely be disappointed; it is not intended to be "realistic." It is, however, intended to be metaphoric with extensive symbolism apparent to those with superb attention to detail.

Captain Corelli's Mandolin is no Oscar contender but it was pretty good. I have to admit Ms Cruz can really act. She puts on a very good performance. In fact she our does her boyfriend Tom in drama. John Hurt was great as usual. Nicholas Cage seemed to be enjoying himself. I bet he felt he was going back to his roots as an Italian. However, I did learn something. One more chapter in Horrors of Nazi Germany the many Italian soliders killed during the period of there surrender to the allies and Germany's eventual surrender.

I never realized what a fabulous dancer Lana Turner was until I saw this movie . She was only 19 years old when this film was shot. She was gorgeous, a true star from the moment she entered the film. This movie also stars Robert Taylor who was 11 years her senior, but she was his equal as an actor and dancer. This movie is definitely worth seeing, not just for its star power, but because the choreography was great. It's from the same period that Fred Astaire, Ginger Rogers, and Gene Kelly were making their dancing marks in film.

Exclusively for Coop's lovers, though Clint Eastwood very strong though unobtrusive presence is a great asset of this very good documentary film. It is a biography of Gary Cooper, based mainly on his filmography, but also on more private archives, which show him as a child, as a young man, as a family man, with some of his friends (Picasso, Hemingway, etc. ), as an older man, finally as a sick and close-to-death man. After "the end", I did not have the feeling that I knew the man any much better.

Chucky is back but this time he is not scary (a lot) - but he is funny!When Chucky is brought back to life (in the doll, of course) by his old trailer trash girlfriend, Tiffany, he promptly kills her and transforms her into a doll, too. Tiffany and Chucky are now on the case of 2 high school graduates - eekkk! !Don't miss this film - it is a whole lot of fun. It is scary, funny, weird, wacky and stupid all in one!My rating : 9/10.

William Faulkner was one of the American writers to win the Nobel Prize in literature. Faulkner mostly wrote about life in the South particularly during the depression years. Many of his stories have been adapted to screen. Short stories like Two Soldiers is an endearing tale of two brothers in December 1941 after the attack on Pearl Harbor. The older brother, Pete Greer, goes to Memphis, Tennessee to enlist like hundreds of thousands of young men, some who would never come home. His younger brother doesn't take his departure well. He manages to get a bus ticket to Memphis without any money to find his brother.

I first started watching The Outer Limits back in 95 when I was 10 , and it just blew my mind away and since I been watching it off and on til this day I own the first season on dvd and I love this show still to this day!!!! Out of all the episodes I like "the Bellero Shield" and "Demon With The glass hands" and "the Architects of Fear", and "A Feasibility study"
I'm glad they'll be showing it again , I will be sure to watch every Saturday night!!!

Well , what 's wrong with the title `` Separate Lies '' ( accused elsewhere of not being `` exciting enough for a blog title ) . Well , I guess when it comes down to it , there are some movies which you just watch without being `` excited '' about them , and if you don't want to watch them , then you watch them anyway . This is one such movie for me , it was on TV the other night so I recorded it , and I thought well , why not . And why not ?

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but manages not to let the film turn into schmalz.This is a fantastic film, its funny with sad bits and it makes you look at things differently. Tell everyone you know to go see it now- FANTASTIC!The acting is excellent, and Dublin plays a starring role. This film will change the way you view people with disabilities and also give you a very entertaining night out in the cinema. I can't wait til it comes out on DVD.

This is one of my favorite films , ever . The story is just so fantastic and the characters are great . The film has got it's funny moments but they are not overdone so that you get tired of the film . I have seen it about 50 times or so and I never get tired of it . I would love it if there was a sequel . The only thing bad i can think of is that in the beginning of the movie when they are on the ship , one of the other guys in the movie looks so much like Willie Nelson that i thought it was him at first .

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre , but I think this one is done quite well. I've always enjoyed stories like this. I love the idea of getting caught in the midst of all the action and having no idea who to trust or which way to turn. I enjoyed the chemistry between the two leads and the way they played off of eachother. I'd love to see a full feature movie with this storyline. It has just enough creepy stuff to keep you on your toes without being gory or terrifying.

What a surprise. A basic copycat of the comedy classic 'The Nutty Professor' only naughtier. Funny guy Tim Thomerson (who steals the show as Blinkin in Robin Hood-Men In Tights) is downright hilarious as the anal retentive Dr. Jekyll and the sex crazed Hyde. The one scene that is really funny is when Dr. Lanyon (Mark Blankfield) catches Jekyll in bed with his daughter and says: "how dare you take advantage of my innocent daughter." Jekyll replies, "but sir, I'm going ahead with the operation. "Lanyon replies back, "oh.

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre . Set in New Orleans , the film has strong elements of voodoo, the supernatural and some nice splatter effects . It stars a very young and good looking Tomas Milian as a man who inherits a fortune, but then discovers that his dead wife's family are out to get him and his wealth . The film has an excellent cast, which also includes Maria Petrano and Maria Teresa Ricci . The film does drag in the middle but once the murdering starts up again, the film becomes much more watchable.

As a film buff , I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny , sarcastic comments about this flick. So what made me go and see this movie ? Well, I like watching a movie at the very first week of its release , so that I could be a part of the audience who watched it at first . The theater was packed. There was an old lady with a hearing problem sitting on my right , who kept looking at me in surprise every time a loud sound came out of the screen . My husband and I were trying very hard to be very attentive .

After seeing The Aristocats : Special Edition in a two pack with The Fox in the Hound , I decided to pick up the Fox and the Hound - Special Edition . This film is not one I am very familiar with, but when I saw this version of it in a two pack at a great price I decided to get it. The movie is about two young animals who are childhood friends. Tod is a young fox and Copper is a pup who has been raised by a hunter. They eventually get separated and when they do they become enemies.

This is a funny movie. The Bob & Eddie Show feel of it could lead to a sequel but I doubt it will make enough money. Deniro proves he can be a great Straight man again with some hilarious and spontaneous moments. Eddie was fun to watch working with people instead of CGI animals and rodents. Rene Russo- well she's just fun to watch anyway and she's played her part excellent.Some wild and unusual stunts, especially the garbage truck scene. This was worth seeing in the theater. We needed a good laugh and got many from the movie and the great out-takes at the end.

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but without being patronising. The story concerns a girl who has just lost her parents, her older brother is mentally retarded and her younger brother is only 7. With no other relatives to help raise the kids, she finds herself having to take on the responsibilty of becoming a parent to her brother which is a big burden for someone so young. The movie shows her taking on her new role while also growing up and experiencing new emotions, such as love, first love.

Is this a good movie? It's hard to say -- but in 1953, for many people, it was a remarkably effective movie, suspenseful, scary and then, amazingly, actually touching when "the old gentleman" meets his unhappy death at the end of the movie.Yes, what lurks in the Maze turns out to be something of a surprise and, for a lot of people, a hilarious one. But the basic idea (ontogeny recapitulates phylogeny) was a very real one at the time the book was written, and does have some basis in fact.

Who ARE the people that star in this thing? Never heard of them!! But this is one of the funniest comedies I have run across. It should win the Putz Puller Prize for Parody. The absurd starts with Dr. Jeykl snorting his powder and turning into a sex fiend.He is pursued by libido driven nurse early in the movie in one of the funniest scenes of the movie. Pay attention to the hospital PA system in the background; rather like the system in MASH. The final scene with Hyde accepting the award has had me laughing for years.

As a film buff, I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny, sarcastic comments about this film (my favourite being Woody Allen's quip "If I had my life to live over again I wouldn't change anything ... except for seeing the musical remake of Lost Horizon"). Therefore I've never been able to watch it without smirking at the choreography/set/songs etc. Just recently I came across a widescreen DVD and watched it for the first time in years, along with a friend who had never heard of the film's reputation.

`` Showtime '' is a funny film starring funnymen Robert DeNiro ( Meet the Parents , A Bronx Tale ) and Eddie Murphy ( Shrek , Beverly Hills Cop ). It has also starred some of the most talented actresses in the industry. Eddie Murphy plays a detective named Mitch and he and his partner, Marcus, played by De Niro, come across a case of art forgery involving a world famous painter. As they investigate the crime they discover that it has many twists and turns, with the main focus of the mystery being a young woman named Sara, who turns out to be one of the artists.

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something "not human" is portraying human beings and I think that this film is one of them. Apart from a few points of the plot and the characters - this film could be changed with all people rather than mainly animals. Although - it's good someone did not - I feel the cats are jolly good in this film portraying humans! :-)This film also focuses on quite a lot of adult issues - which is rather odd for a Disney film.

This is a wonderful movie , and I still love it ! It just so magical and it is funny , and the characters are very likable . The movie makes me laugh every time , and it makes me want to be back in my childhood . The characters are good , and the acting is wonderful , and the costumes are colorful . This is a magical movie that i will always love ! This is a movie that is timeless , and a movie that everyone can love . The movie is very good , and it will be one that I will watch over and over again .

I 've heard a lot of different opinions about this film and then to find out that Paris Hilton was in it, but you know what, it surprised me that I liked it. Of course it has some bad things, like some of the acting is a bit weak, but as a horror film, it's just good enough. It is very scary at the beginning, when the couple was in the desert, they were on their way to their wedding, and then the car just stops. Then he goes out and hears strange sounds around him.

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback , and if anyone is confused about her past ( like me! )...this is how it plays out.. I think she is talking about her and Eloise, who we learn later was a psychologist...who had a thing for Desmond, so she was trying to keep him safe. Libby is in the looneybin...and she was a patient who wanted to escape, who escaped with Desmond... In the present , Desmond is the only one on the boat that knows he's on an island..

NIGHTS IN RODANTHE brings back to the screen two talented actors in Diane Lane and Richard Gere in a simply beautiful yet heartbreakingly sad tale. The film begins at the funeral of Adrienne Willis (Lane), a New York journalist and mother of two who, after 12 years of marriage has just separated from her husband. On the way back home on the same day she has to pick up her 14-year-old daughter and return to New York. She arrives back at her beautiful house on the beach in North Carolina to find that the house has been rented out to a handsome stranger, Paul (played by Richard Gere).

I am a guy , so i was very hesitant to watch the movie because i know that Richard Gear is so beautiful , and i dont want to feel like a gay guy watching the movie . But after watching the movie , i feel that it's a very touching love story and i enjoy the movie very much . I know it must be very painful for the director , and it's a kind of sacrifice . I really enjoy watching the movie . Hmm. I've been seeing a number of movies recently that touch me quite a bit. 'The Notebook', for instance.

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development . Fulci was a master at creating horrific scenes of terror without gore. This film was an excellent addition to his already stellar resume'. I was pleasantly surprised by The Beyond. I expected a trashy, gory film. Instead, the film is slow and moody and the gore is limited to the last 20 minutes of the film. The atmosphere is what I liked most about The Beyond. The soundtrack, the visuals and the direction are all top notch. The Beyond is an excellent example of why Fulci should be considered an important director.

I saw this film at a small screening . Even though it had a low budget , the creative direction , the music choices and the cast , I am glad to be part of it . I had a lot of fun , and I can't wait for the next one . Stay tuned for more . Here is the teaser for the short film LIFT. It was a very nice experience . Here are a couple of images of my character from this upcoming short . I would like to wish a very happy 4th of July to all of my friends and followers .

I saw this movie on PBS the first time . Then I bought the video and watched it countless times. I recently purchased it on DVD and watch it over and over again. Great movie with a wonderful message to our children and society. We have seen this movie numerous times, and it still holds up well. It's a good movie for a family movie night. I thought it was a very enlightening movie. The story was easy to follow, yet deep in the way that all stories are. The characters were all very dynamic and real.

I love this movie, though I don't like how they picture Egyptians, being an Egyptian citizen myself! that's why it earns an eight out of 10.The relationship between Augustin and the leopard is awkward, and of course because of loneliness and living in that cave for quite so long, he develops a kind of insanity and passion to that leopard.A very touching scene when the leopard dies, watch Augustin's reaction.. All in all I find it enjoyable, and I'm looking forward to reading the short story by Balzac.

This film had about everything one could wish when viewing it originally , at the end of the 1960 's. It has an amazing sound track. I think it is so good I bought the LP from Amazon. It is set on the fictional "Island of Peace" and has a great cast. Richard Harris and Jean Seberg were my favourites. It was also the first of a long line of films which had a young Harrison Ford as their star. The film was shot in the Bahamas , so there was no expense spared on the wonderful scenery.

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to them. If you want them to laugh, too. I love it. And now it is the only one of the series I have left. I've never watched this movie. Although I've seen every other movie in the series, I can't even remember seeing this one's title on TV, let alone rent it. I know I've seen this one but not in a while. I'm with you though. This may be the best one.

The story starts out with a soldier being transported to a desert town then goes back in time to tell the story of how he came to be there. In the flash back you get a little bit of what is happening in the present while the story focuses on the soldier. The story is interesting but I feel it was too long and could have easily been shorter and more effective. The book is also full of clichéd situations that I found boring. Besides being long I did enjoy it and I'm glad that I got it for free.

My college theater just had a special screening last night of this film . I have got to say that this is probably the best film I've seen this semester in my cinema class , and I love the fact that the director went with an older camera and used film , it just felt more authentic and less CGI than what we usually get from hollywood . I actually had to get into character for this role as it was very challenging to do. I am a 5'11 132lbs and I had to play an older woman.

What an excellent movie, made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it so serendipitously, channel surfing on a nice frozen day in North Texas. Kathy Bates is at her usual best leading a cast of very normal and human costar characters thru one of the most wonderful feel good movies we've ever seen. Why this movie wasn't given the attention it deserved on it's release in 2002 is difficult to understand. Why it was head and shoulders above so many of the boring pieces of trash released with greater fanfare and attention is evident in the viewing.

I first saw The Victim ( aka Out Of Contention ) well over 25 years ago when I was very young, and had to wait until the film came to TV before I could see it, as it had been banned in my home country of South Africa. My first thought after seeing it was 'that was good' , my next thought after it was over, 'I need to see that again'. As I grew up I started seeing more and more of director Pat Jackson's work. I love his films, and I am sure I have not seen them all.

People comparing this movie to big blockbusters like Lord of the Rings or the Matrix will inevitably be disappointed with the way this movie turned out. Although it lacks in the big special effects department and there are no battles with hundreds of extras, there is still a masterful amalgamation of two old folk tales here. The acting talent, although not A-list, is still great and the interaction between the characters is perhaps more sincere than in a larger movie with an A-list cast. My particular favourite from this movie is Bridget Fonda, whose performance as the Snow Queen herself was quite moving, assisted enormously by a stupendous wardrobe and makeup.

"Back in the Day" is an interesting, but flawed effort. Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper, a honest but sad man trying to cope with the death of his father. He meets his old friend J-Bone (Ving Rhames) who tries to force Reggie into a life of crime. Reggie also falls in love with Alica (Tatyana Ali) who is the preacher's daughter. Now he has to choose: Love Or Crime.Ja Rule does a competent job as Reggie. At least he's trying to act. Ving Rhames is perfect as J-Bone.

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful place in cult film history. But Fulci has also made a couple of great Euro-cult westerns during the 1970s that often goes overlooked by many western fans. Amongst these westerns are the very underrated I quattro dell'apocalisse from 1975, an atmospheric mix of western and horror. The film takes place in a small western town in 1880 and tells the tale about four mysterious men that shows up in town riding four white horses. There is rumors about these four men being involved in robberies in other western towns.

This show really is the Broadway American Idol. It has singing, the British Guy, A guy who's sometimes nice, and a super-nice woman.Of course it is different because there is a sing-off, and there's dancing and some acting (we just don't see some of the acting). I gave this show a 7 because there are a couple tweaks that I know a lot of people (including me)would make if they were working for the show. The first thing that really needs to be changed is the judges deciding who goes home.

Anyone who has seen Ali G before , should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G Indahouse'! After 3 very funny TV series, Ali G has now finally got his own full length movie! "Based upon the most successful comedy series ever made, ALI G INDAHOUSE is the hilarious big-screen adventure of our beloved hero. As the world's most wanted man, Ali G unwittingly becomes the centre of attention to the British media when his passport is discovered in the possession of an arms dealer.

This movie possesses something most other movies of its genre do not : intelligence and good messages . Accepted , though entertaining , is only a funny movie . This movie is a lot more : it is a lesson to be learned for everybody who wants to find the way to success . This movie will help you understand that it is you who can achieve your own success : that no one can help you with it . The main character in the movie ( played brilliantly by Michael Keaton ) is very different from you and me : he has nothing at all , no education , and no family .

I think this show was right on the money for me. I watched it over the plane but there were parts in the movie that made me control myself from tearing all over the place. The chemistry between Richard gere and Diane lane was very believable (fantastic acting on both parts)! I loved how Diane lane's daughter acted in the show too. She displayed maturity and how she transformed throughout the show was easy to believe as what a teenager could possibly be like in real life. I loved this show from start to end. Definitely recommended for the romantic people out there!

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans . Okay I 'm sure it 's not as good as the others but I enjoyed it. It 's a little bit of fun. Chuckie's a good guy this time...I think. I know it is hard to believe. This is my favorite Chucky movie since Bride Of Chucky. It is a good film for kids. I had a good time seeing this at the theater with my five year old daughter. She was not scared during the film and enjoyed it. I felt it was better than the first two films.

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year. You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime, and Court TV can be relied on for a few every weekend. So I started watching The Morrison Murders thinking I knew very well what to expect: a more or less competent retelling of a real-life family murder. What I got was a subtle, beautifully acted drama that engrossed me from start to finish.Both the brothers were totally convincing, and Jonathan Scarfe was perfect in the challenging role of Luke. The look and feel of Georgia was in almost every frame.

My husband and I watched this last night ... It was wonderful .... For once he was wrong in guessing the ending and the ending did not involve a car crash ..... But it would have been good to see the other ending as well. We had watched it last week, thought it was good. I'm glad you watched it and enjoyed it. I'll give a spoiler alert. It was about a young mother who loses her baby and how she goes through different stages of her life before she finds her happiness. I have been thinking about that movie too ...

This movie gives us some WWII history along with some touching romance, a little fantasy and meaningful emotion - and beautiful scenery. Nicholas Cage never fails us, and here again does a great job. And so do the other principle characters. One key charater, the physician/father played by John Hurd, delivers (to his daughter) one of the best definitions of love I've ever heard. Some of the events are a bit too coincidental to be real, but I excused that, knowing that this is partly fairy tale and fantacy. My wife and I really liked the film.

As I have said before , I am NOT a fan of Tweety . He 's just so aggravating I can't stand him . He's just soooooooooooooooooooooooo condescending . I am glad to see his ratings going down . I just wonder who is going to be the next talking head with their head up their *** to be put on the hot seat by the Right ? Tweety's got a real chip on his shoulder . I'll bet if you go through the archives of this board, you'll find more people who share your opinions of Tweety as you will the people who defend him.

This version of `` The Lost Horizon '' is actually not a bad film at all . I think the main problem is a lot of the people who have never read the book did not like the movie because they were going in to watch an action packed film and got something else, something much better. The only reason why I think people should have known what this movie was really about before watching it was because it was based off a famous book, but I do not think that is enough for a person to know if they will like it before watching the movie.

OK , so I loved Rachael Ray before , but now , I ADORE her ! How innovative . I have been doing this for years, although I had forgotten it . I love that she gave this to people in a restaurant , I have not done that but it would be fun ! You could be creative and draw a heart and write I Love You on a napkin and give that as a present to a person . I know my Mom would be tickled pink about that . She has always loved to get little things like that . They are so fun !

Very touching film , a great surprise to come up from Brazil , a country that usually exports features about Carnaval, sex, and drugs. This is another story. It remembers me a little of “Alice in Wonderland” because the main character of the story is a girl with a serious mental disorder, but she is very different from “Alice”, because she is a woman, and she is very young. “Alice” in this film is played by Marilia Pera, who was a model and the film started as a video.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a party dressed as a penguin or whatever... They might wanna consider the possibility that the party-goers might not even notice their there. I mean, it'd be kinda like dressing in a black suit and being a chalk outline of a person. Though maybe you'd get to dance with somebody. I guess that it's a good thing that I've never felt the need to be somebody that I'm not. But I can understand why people want to become somebody else, even for just one night.

I can't say how many times that one line has made me laugh or how often I've described that scene to folks not familiar with this film. I saw it the year it was released, I was 19. I don't think there were a dozen people in that East Village theater that night. For years I thought we were the only ones who saw it. Nice to see here that others found it as hysterical as I had, and see it's lasting value despite the time gone by. Rent it, buy it or steal it.... a must see.

At one time ` Buddy Cop ' movies ruled the box office . It seemed that every summer flocks of people poured into the movie theaters to watch such flicks as ` Police Academy ' or ` Lethal Weapon ' . But in recent years , the sub genre seems to have fallen by the wayside . ` The Heat ' is the latest film in the lineage but I have to say , I think this is a solid addition . While on an undercover mission , Detective Mullins ( Jamie Foxx ) is killed and Boston Detective Sargent Mullins ( Melissa McCarthy ) is demoted to patrol.

At one time `Buddy Cop' movies ruled the box office. It seemed that every summer flocks of Beverly Hills Cop wannabes descended on our nation's theaters. Not any more. Lately the gusher has dried to barely a trickle. The drought has eased a bit recently with the release of Showtime, a movie that is a genuinely funny and consistently entertaining example of the genre.Mitch Preston is a dedicated cop. He's not a Dirty Harry type by any means. He's just incredibly focused professional who's completely intolerant of anything that gets in the way of the performance of his dutieslike, say, a T.V.

I am a guy, so i was very hesitant to watch the movie because i know that Richard Gear likes to be in tear jerker movies. I would rather watch action/adventure/sci fi. I was right, the movie is definitely a tear jerker. Diane tended to over act a few times, as did richard, but they brought it around and made it work. The daughter was a suppressed teen with huge attitude, so you started out hating her. The movie is way too predictable, but for entertainment purposes, it was a masterpiece.

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery 's best performances in a movie , and I have seen almost all of her work in film , she is great , as are her co stars in this movie , you won 't be disappointed !!! It’s amazing. I love it. I’ve seen it a million times. Well written, good acting, good directing. Sad, yet a very good movie!! Great movie. The actors were good too. Lots of drama, and lots of tears. I really liked it.

Nominated for best documentary feature at 2004 's Academy Awards , My Architect follows filmmaker Nathaniel Kahn in his quest to understand his estranged father, the legendary architect Louis I Kahn. Kahn, who is most famous for buildings such as The Kimbell Art Museum, the Salk Institute and the Parliament House in Dhaka, is considered by many to be the greatest of the great American architects. He was also an infamous womanizer and egotist, and Kahn's family was his third wife's family. Kahn, as a young man, worked for Frank Lloyd Wright.

I saw a sneak preview of this Tuesday night with a group of friends and we had a blast! After seeing sneak peaks for BOOGEYMAN (Horrible! 3/10) and Amityville Remake (so-so 6/10) I enjoyed this a lot more! As seen in the trailer, one knock I had was believing that a whole town could be "forgotten" but this is a cheesy popcorn horror movie so I accept it for what it is.My only major complaint is I assumed Paris Hilton would touch wax or get dipped etc. and moan "that's hot" but they didn't do that (how could they resist???

I wonder why I haven't heard of this movie before. It's truly a magnificent comedy (I'd say farce, but it's too well acted and I'd hate to denigrate it's quality). A comedic character study about the travails of mid-life crises, the inequity for gays who can't have their long-time unions recognized, and the general differences of people who can't fit nicely into society, that pairs Kathy Bates and Rupert Everett to a wonderful effect. Forget Julia Roberts and Rupert; Kathy Bates and Rupert should do another movie together.

I went to the pre-screening of "Rory O'Shea Was Here." I like this movie better than I expected, because the excellent casts and the powerful performance. It's a film about the friendship of two handicapped young man. Rory is free spirit young man who wants to be independent regardless his Duchenne muscular dystrophy. He can only move his two fingers but he can talk eloquently and help his new pal, Michael, who has cerebral palsy and is significantly speech impaired. I guess that's enough to start with a weeping drama. Well, it is.

Mark Blankfield (from the old late night TV show "Fridays")plays Dr. Daniel Jekyll, a mild-mannered surgeon who invents a powder that turns him into a drug-crazed party animal. This was not, of course, his intent, he had higher aspirations, but he goes with the flow. This is actually a fairly stupid movie, but it's also pretty fun. Of course, once the good doctor realizes what he's done, he's ashamed, but he's also not above doing it all again & running through Hollywood as a crazed sex machine with frizzed out hair & gold chains.

As the mom of a 3 year old and a 2 year old, I adore AristoCats. It is a movie that contains no double-entendres, no almost-swear words like heck or darn, no parents who are functional idiots, and no crotch-smashing or flatulence jokes that are so prevalent in even the "best" kids movies these days. The story line is sweet and interesting. The music is great. The love story is quite romantic. The kittens are adorable, and the various other characters are unique and attention-capturing. The action is simple and not overwhelming or confusing.

I love this movie a lot. I must get this on DVD. I have 2 VHS copies, but the quality is so poor that you can't read one written joke over the door of the ward. I'm forever amazed that Blankfield did almost nothing afterward. He made both Dr. Jeckle and Mr. Hyde totally believable.The movie is plagued by it's low budget. (One atrocious edit jumps into mid-word and was described on, "Siskel & Ebert".) But, there are a thousand jokes, sight gags to subtle references, that more than compensate.

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel , I have to say I was very impressed. The episodes are very entertaining and full of action (obviously). It is a shame that the last 2 episodes of the series weren't aired on the Action Channel. I've now bought the series on DVD from Amazon and have to say I am really impressed with the quality of it. Now if they could just re-make the series, then we might have something really good on our hands! I saw them years ago on BBC1.

This is a 100% improvement over the dross of a third movie and it's one hell of a good time. This is a John Hughes movie meets The Devil's Rejects. I really enjoyed this movie and it really stands out as the savior of the series. I thought Jennifer Tilly played Tiffany really well and Brad Dourif in Chucky's shoes once again really makes this movie shine. Actually they're the only good parts of the movie. I got rather bored with Katherine Heigl and Nick Stable's scenes. It's as if they were thrown in there as a sidetrack and someone to save the day.

I thought this was movie was great , Richard Greico and Yasmine Bleeth have great chemistry in this movie . I have to disagree with some of the other reviewers though , I don't think this is a good movie for children . There is alot of violence in this film , the movie is a little slow at first , but I thought that the end of the film made the movie worth while to watch . This is an excellent film . I think the only thing that could have made this film better was to have Richard Greico do a voice over explaining what was going on at the end of the movie .
