You'll hear about how a dolphin swims and feeds, but it never moves from that point.

If you like who-dun-its , you will like this film , considered the best Italian detective story ( giallo ) ever made ! The cast is perfect for the period , the camera work is amazing ( for that time !) and the music fits perfectly the mood of the movie ! The plot is not really original ( as it is not for all the gialli of that period !) and I don't like that the bad guy got the girl in the end ( as it happened in all the other movies of that type ) but, all in all , this is the best example of that genre I ever saw !

Just about every commentator has mentioned the way that some of the interview footage is superposed over the concert footage in places. This is true, and is the biggest flaw of this film. However, it isn't so often, or so bad, that one shouldn't see this video. If you are a Black Sabbath fan, you have to see this. Aside from having seen Black Sabbath in the Sevnties and early Eighties, I saw them in 2005 or 2006 when they also headlined OZZfest just like in this video.

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie (I have lived here my whole life), I have waited for this movie to come out. And I mean waited and waited and waited over a year and a half for this movie and to me, it was worth it.The movie is different from the book but in my eyes, it's still a beautiful piece of work as is the book. In both I cried, there were moments that tore me up. I laughed and I smiled just as much.

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre, but I think this one is done quite well.It's twistedly cute clever & dark. This story brought back memories of the types of girls I was in love with as a child.Also, it makes me want to check out some of Nadia's other movies, many youtube comments about how hot she is in this video. Sure there is some Burton influence here, but I wouldn't say this Brad is trying to rip him off.He is just jumping in & adding his talents to a genre that I can appreciate.

This movie is beautiful in all ways . It is visually stunning , and this is a good thing since it has no dialogue what-so-ever . The acting is all done with gestures , expressions , and movements . So if you are going to see this you better understand that you will get out of it exactly what you put in. This film takes place in a time that is not specified . I have a feeling it was not long after the Civil War because I noticed the men all had their hair very long and it would not have looked that way right after the war .

What an incredible story and what a beautiful film ! Hat 's off to Ben Daniels , Lavinia Currier and all the actors who made this possible ! It was such a privilege to watch it in my classroom ! The kids were enchanted . What a beautiful documentary. I would also like to buy a dvd of this film. I would also like to purchase a copy of the movie. How much is the dvd? We would all like a DVD! Wondering if there is a DVD version, would love to have for our library. Can I buy this on a DVD?

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie. But really all the characters are amazingly fun to watch. (MINOR SPOILERS) As per usual, the main character, B, is the sane one of the bunch. B has this crazy idea to make up his own college when he's rejected from all colleges he applies to. He's known for making fake IDs. so an acceptance letter is no problem.Because B's dad is a hard @$$ and suspicious of this university he's never heard of, B gets his friend Sherman to design a website for the university.

Fantastic Chaplin movie with many memorable moments as Charlie joins the army to fight in WW 1.At first he goes to boot camp but ends up as a cook and has to deal with some spoiled rich kids who are serving in the military as punishment. There is a great scene where Charlie tries to teach them how to clean a mess hall which has to be seen to be truly understood. There is a lot more in this film including an interesting subplot of Charlie falling for an officer’s wife. If you can get a widescreen DVD then it is highly recommended.

Before I forget , let me say the artwork in here is outstanding . From garbage cans to the huge monsters. It's fantastic , I only have 2 nitpicks , first , I feel the monsters are to big . I love the artwork and I can clearly see the detail and work put in to making them but in my honest opinion they feel off . I have no idea what the scale of the world is so I can't really say how large they are supposed to be but to me I think they are too big compared to people .

Surprisingly effective British drama about two very different people who find common ground , and in particular the `` flowering`` of one in the presence of the other. At first sight, the characters are unlikely candidates for such growth, but as the film unfolds they both come to grips with the reality that neither of them will ever have a truly fulfilling relationship with another. The film is very realistic in its characterisations, which may be off putting for some viewers, but for a serious film lover this adds to the richness of the drama. I found it touching and poignant, and very satisfying overall.

Telling the story wouldn't be the point at all, would it? Barnens ö, spelled almost like "booné aww" is the title for that brilliant novel of the late seventies that shocked a lot of people, including myself.Children's Island is the title, and what an island. In the book, Raine, the main character has The Guiness World Record Book as his own Bible. And he's keen on breaking new records himself. In particular the youngest person under water for three minutes.The story is, as most Swedish films and books of the time, deep, consciously provocative and awe inspiring.

This interesting film noir features three very good performances: Sanders, Patrick, and Blackmer. The scenes between Sanders and Patrick are particularly outstanding. Demming, as the detective, is unfortunately not nearly as good. He lacks the intelligence, strength, and cynical world view of a Bogart. Had Humphrey played this part, we could have had a classic.Pace, location (a library), and atmosphere are all good. But there are a few plot holes. Sanders strongly fears Blackmer and the ruthless organization (Nazis) he represents. Yet after mistakenly killing Blackmer, Sanders seems to experience no anxiety or remorse.

I had heard of John Garfield , but , did n't know him . I loved this movie . I was very touched by his acting , especially the scenes with Patricia Collinge , his mother , I was moved by her performance too . A sad story , well told , I will be back to watch this one again , as I did with all your blog movies , thank you . Wishing all the members and their families happiness and prosperity in 2014. Thank you! And to you and yours. A truly great actor in his prime.

I really loved this movie and have spent several years trying to get it. It is just not available and it has not been on TV for many many years. I enjoyed it and the songs because it had something different to say and made you think how every person looks at something from different prespectives. Also we often don't appreciate something we have till it is no longer there.My 12 year old daughter just discoverd the music and is entranced with some of the songs. Someday I hope to get a copy of the film so she can have an opportunity to view it.

Just as in "Columbo" we see the fatality occur right at the beginning. What follows is an escalating web of lies, sex, blackmail, and murder. The investigating officer, Adam Arkin, is even somewhat of a fumbler, not unlike "Columbo". It is William H. Macy, as the movie critic suspect who carries the film. Constantly twisting and turning, the plot sends Macy deeper and deeper into the quicksand of his "perfect crime". William H. Macy fans will enjoy "A Slight Case Of Murder", as will those who like crime capers with all kinds of delicious possibilities.

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fears and fantasies people have about their lives when they are in the audience, watching other people on stage. There are moments when you wish the film went even farther, and moments when you're not so sure that you wanted to go that far with it. It has a surreal quality that gives you pause. The acting is generally good, and there are a number of scenes where the audience is watching a scene and you wonder whether what you are watching is a play or the film itself.

"Head" is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968. The movie is a complete contradiction of the Monkees image. It presents the Monkees in a way their fans never perceived them; men with real thoughts. Totally controlled by their producers, the Monkees were given the opportunity to tell their side of the story. The film pokes fun at their image, the entertainment industry, and corporate America. The soundtrack contains some of their best music. It's a movie well worth seeing over and over again.

This is what movies should aspire to . Funny without being totally stupid , a little sexy without having every other scene being an excuse for nudity or sexual encounters , action without overdoing it with explosions or fights . A good mix of humor , action and drama. The cast is really good , great performance by Samuel L. Jackson who looks like he had a lot fun with his part . The story is a bit weird and has some plot holes in it . A lot of characters are just there for a few seconds and then vanish . Overall a good movie that I would totally watch again .

When I saw this movie i expected it to be a cheesy American movie done on the cheap with appalling actors. I was really surprised to find that i was totally wrong. The movie centres around Bartely or B who has been rejected from all of his colleges- the actor who play B is very natural and makes his character seem real- and decides to create a pretend school so his parents stop harassing him. However loads of people see his fake website and join. Feeling their sorrows B can't turn them away much to the chagrin of his best mate.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be . Terrible acting ! Implausible scenerios ! Ridiculous deaths ! Continuity errors a plenty . The list goes on . But it’s the 3rd installment of what’s already a silly series . So you’ll be entertained . But it’ll be because you want to laugh at it . It’s that kind of movie . The one that makes you wonder how the hell it even came to be . I just don’t have a whole lot to say about Death Wish 3 that hasn’t been said many times before .

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie . It follows all the standard movie conventions: the main character is introduced to the audience as a lonely guy, who has no friends and has just moved to a new place, he gets to know his next door neighbour (who also happens to be the girl next door and is a hot chick) and so on. I am a bit biased when watching this movie since I am a sucker for these rom-coms, so it may have seemed better than it was, but this is a must-watch movie.

This is one of the best of the early `` Star Trek '' episodes , with Kirk and his crew being sent to the surface of a planet whose inhabitants look very much like ancient Vulcans. The reason for this is quite a mind blower, and it is one of the episodes that can stand on its own without any knowledge of the other episodes. 10/11/2006 (07:00 PM): This was the episode that made me watch the original Trek series. I grew up with Next Generation, and while I enjoyed it, I had never actually watched the original.

I'm not a massive Disney fan, but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them, so we've built up quite a collection, and this is one of my favourites. We first saw this a couple of weeks ago and we must have see it half a dozen times since! OK, as others have pointed out, not the most complex or inventive of plots, but there's more to a film than that.Great characters, Phil Harris stealing the show as Thomas O'Malley, but Edgar the butler not far behind.

The cinema of the 60s was as much as time of revolution as the politics and the music . Filmmakers were re-thinking what was allowed, what could be achieved and how they should work. It was a fascinating time, and it was one that spawned all sorts of new ideas and techniques. One of the ways that this was achieved was through what was called ‘Cowboy’ Cinema. What Cowboy Cinema did was to take the Western and use it as a base to explore new narratives, experiment with form and create something new.

This film, like much of their music, is either underrated or unnoticed by the casual observer. It is terrific and, in many ways, ahead of its time.The images are funny, disturbing, and at the very least, engaging. The music is amazing. This is not the "candy pop" sound they are unfortunately associated with. This is the sound of a band in exploration and revolt.HEAD, alone, should put The Monkees into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Can anyone tell me why these guys are not in there?

The story starts out with a soldier being transported to a desert town then goes back in time to tell the tale of how he came to this place. He started out as an officer in Napoleon's army fighting in Egypt but became separated from his unit. After nearly starving and/or dying of thirst he came upon a leopard which somehow became his bosom buddy. It brought him food and before long the soldier became almost totally wild so acute was his bonding with the animal. All things do end however and the man decided it was necessary for him to leave the critter.

This is my favourite Columbo. Martin Landau (excellent!) plays twins, one of whom may have committed a murder. This Columbo is unusual because the usual murder scene at the beginning doesn't give you any clue to which one did it! Peter Falk is on form as usual in this episode written by Steven Bochco (who also wrote 'Murder by the Book', my second favourite episode). The supporting cast are great especially Julie Newmar (very under-rated) and Jeanette Nolan as the house keeper that Columbo just keeps on upsetting.

Do you liked `` Dead Man do n't wear Plaid '' ? What about `` Top Secret '' and `` Spies Like Us '' ? Do you also love the 80's soundtracks ? Well, you will like this EP. 4 new tracks for a retro-style electronic pop. A little bit of darkwave. A little bit of synthpop. A lot of love. Vinyl and cassete tapes are still available in the shop. Get them while you can! I’m not sure how this came to my attention but it did, and I just have to let you know, I really love this album.

"Pearl Harbor, buddy." This movie is brilliant! Sure it doesn't exactly flow like an multi-million dollar comedy does, but the jokes that are constantly thrown in are unbelievable. I'm one that goes for silliness, much like "Dumb and Dumber", "Airplane" and "Wet Hot American Summer" and I have to say this easily ranks up there. Movies just aren't written with this kind of sporadic comedy anymore. Too many jokes in this are such a surprise to the viewer that it's honestly amazing that more don't know about and praise this slapstick masterpiece!

1969 was the year . New York City was the place . Putney Swoope was the second Robert Downey film . And it was directed by Robert Downey's dad, Robert Downey Sr. . And I think that's enough information to help you understand that this film is going to be something really fucking strange, and not in a bad way. Not in a bad way at all, but just different. It is a film about the life of Putney, an unsuccessful and untalented comedian, who goes from the top of the comedy world when his TV show becomes a smash to the bottom rung when it becomes a smash.

This is one of the finest TV movies you could ever see . The acting , writing and production values make it a great movie for anytime viewing . I wish they would rebroadcast this as I have been searching for this movie and I am not sure that I ever saw the whole movie . I would love for it to be rebroadcasted as I think it should be seen by as many folks as are able to enjoy it as I have enjoyed it on several occasions . . . I remember watching this movie 30 years ago when it was originally broadcast and it had a big impact.

Barbora Bobulova 's portrayal of Valeria in this story was entirely captivating and heart wrenching at the same time . I loved her and couldn't find fault with how she was played . I hope we see a lot more of her in this series because she was perfect in every way for the role of this young woman who lost her life . I think we have yet to see if this story ends in the real world as it did for her. I think it ends very differently and we are seeing only what she is experiencing in her last days.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos either. Ali G Indahouse is a hilarious laugh-a-second fun fest - just like on the small screen. He has lost none of his character or stupidity at all, and behind all that - none of the film is brainless fluff either. A human side to Ali is revealed during the film, the idea of Ali G running for PM is a brilliant, fresh and funny one - and the incessant stupidity of Staines' gangster man is mixed well with the stern, harsh world that is politics.

I've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months (maybe longer but not much). I was very infatuated with Olivia and I found Kevin to be very witty and the repertoire between them very good. Lately though it's starting to wear thin due to many factors for me. First my favorite segment is the first 15 minutes called Around The Net, that shows 5 video clips that you would find on a site like Youtube, that are generally funny, or of people getting hurt inadvertently (some intentionally).

I just thought I would add another observation, here. While there are a couple of visual sub-references, in this episode, to the possibility of unexpressed feelings between Jim Kirk and Yeoman Janice Rand; there is a special, physically tender, moment, toward the end. When the Enterprise is reversing at emergency warp speed in an attempt to outrun a possibly fatal Romulan plasma ball, Janice, perhaps fearing that their life is about to come to a dramatic end, seeks comfort by placing her head on Jim's sympathetic shoulder as they observe the aproaching instrument of their impending doom on the main viewer.

I 've been a fan of Rachael 's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network , so I was excited to see this book. Rachael is fun, entertaining and a very talented chef. This book has recipes for every occasion. I love Rachael's spunk and I can't wait to try some new recipes from this book. If you have never seen Rachael Ray's day time show on the food network, you'll just have to watch a few minutes, and that will be enough to get addicted. She really is fun and you can see her personality really does shine through with her show.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film, like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles, as just another patchwork of mindless violence. And while there is a fair amount of mayhem, DEATH WISH 3 is not that awful of an effort, particularly for fans of the series and its star.This time out, aging Charlie's Paul Kersey is let loose by a police chief desperate to clean up a rough part of New York City. The trigger-happy vigilante moves into the heart of gang territory, where he once again becomes a one-man army in an urban war of good versus evil.

Hey look, you don't watch this movie to change your life! But if you are female especially and have always had a little thing for Richard Gere; this movie is right up your street. Diane Lane and Richard Gere have on screen chemistry going way back. 'Nights in Rodanthe' is not a Oscar winner movie and it will probably be forgotten sooner rather than later but if you want an atmospheric, beautifully shot love story between MIDDLE AGED good looking people (they don't make your stomach turn and even when Gere is 'on top' he does not look too jowly) then this is the movie for you.

I still can't describe what to feel when I received this by the fnac site. Such a rare movie, so little spoken and known, is difficult to find, even to fans, but the contrast betwen past and present is devastating: now I hold a DVD of the movie, with the finest quality possible. As I did in Atlantis, the other rare Besson movie I bought by the internet, I saw this one at home, with all the lights of my dvd and tv turned off, and marveled at the experience. I didn't know what to expect.

Chaplin enters the trenches of WWI in this spirited comedy that never belittles the horrors of war . The rain of bullets and bombs is choreographed by the master of cinema to produce a daring and beautiful film. Winner of Oscars for Best Adapted Screenplay and Best Actor, the film was nominated for three others, including Best Film and Best Cinematography, where it was unsurprisingly beaten by WWI-rival film "Wings". The film was also nominated for a Golden Globe Award for Best Film Promoting International Understanding. It lost to "Mata Hari".

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson 's work , and for about as long as I 've been following him this film has been a passion project. His films are always visually pleasing and action packed , and I can say without hesitation that The Fifth Element will always have a high spot on my favorite movie list. It amazes me that production companies will sue because of reproductions they will not supply . I 've been looking for reproductions for 1934 and 1935 3M tire advertisements . I did find one in 1936 but nothing before that . I'll have to use a photo from my 2 tires . I just bought a 225/16 Firestone tire to make a pattern. It was the only one I've found for my size, but it's only 2/32" over the shoulder. I've had good results using the tire from the car (if it's the original size).

Lucio Fulci 's `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by mysterious child murders. It's an effective shocker in the vein of Dario Argento and Mario Bava, with a dash of ``The Wicker Man's'' Celtic mysticism, a few nods to ``Psycho,'' and more than a hint of ``The Devil's Rain.'' Fulci manages to build a great sense of tension, though the film's ultimate revelation seems to have been cribbed from a ``Tales From The Crypt'' cartoon. The movie is set in a fictional village called Accendura.

Great show ! About time a reality TV show comes along that closes generation gaps . Contestants range in ages. It was funny to see my husband laughing and he usually doesn’t laugh at anything. I’m hoping the show is not rigged as most other reality TV shows. It will be an interesting to see if people watch. Hilarious! I can’t wait to watch the second episode! Wow, I’m sorry this is the first time I am hearing of this, I have to check it out soon.

I first saw The Buddy Holly Story when I was about seven years old. I had no idea who Buddy Holly was, nor can I remember what it was that made me sit down in front of the television, tuned in to HBO, and watch this engaging biopic. What I remember was realizing that it was a (somewhat) true story, about someone who actually lived. I recall the music, great songs that I still love today (I can't believe Gary Busey sang his own songs and so well - What a stud!) Then, came the end.

No real plot, no character development, no Scorcese-level direction, but seriously, were you really expecting any of this? The only thing that matters is that this flick is absolutely hilarious, nearly on the same level as Borat. Sure, the ending drags a bit, but if Borat's cameo didn't crack you up, you must be the worst batty boy in the history of batty boys. Sacha Baron Cohen is possibly the greatest comedian ALIVE, and here he gets more laughs than Jude Law on a nude beach.

Valeria, an elegant and pretty young lady lives in a world surrounded by the walls of her shyness and depression. Although she may have a one-night lover or if someone lives with her, it makes no difference of being completely alone. Valeria is also a passionate woman who can take actions to approach that special man, Massimo, and at the same time the fear that allows her to answer his questions only with a "yes", "no" or "I don't know". The way to accent the loneliness of the character is magnificent.

I never heard of architect , Louis Kahn , until this documentary . In this almost two hour documentary which was filmed during Kahn 's lifetime , we are taken from his early childhood and his development into a prominent Architect . We also get to travel to various locations that Kahn was involved with and get to hear some of the people that was involved with some of his more important works . The film has some very nice shots of his early works and the narration was well done with a variety of opinions about Kahn as an architect.

If you are looking for a phony Hollywood action movie, this won't be one for you. If the Truth is what you seek, rent or buy this. From a true story, the movie attempts to capture the heart of what was/is happening in South Africa (and many other places).For historical knowledge, this rates up there with stories such as "The Pianist," "Schindler's List" or "Nuremberg." Millions of people today have no clue what apartheid is or that it even exists. This movie may help them learn, and may even help them dig deeper.

Too bad somebody did not have the smarts to release this movie to theaters. I had never heard of it when it appeared on cable. After the first shock of realizing this is not like any other movie you have seen since Bringing Up Baby you have to let it sweep you along and run with it. Not until it's over do you realize it covers issues that are not only subtle but significant. Alienation, denial, wish-fulfillment, for a start. Cathy Bates owns this movie, she's never been better.

As with so many modern US films, there has to be a supernatural element to the plot, but if you just let that go, this is a tale with heaps of charm and a kindly heart cased in a crab shell.We are presented with a scene of a town in an economically depressed area struggling to find anything to be happy about. Beau Bridges' character is really up against it with a family on the increase, a nil bank balance and a brother-in-law who's sold out to a big business chain which he secretly hates, but in which he is willing to rub Beau's nose.

`` Head '' is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968 . The film had a lot of buzz at the time it came out . The film had a lot to do with politics . Not sure why the other comment on this film was so negative, but I loved this movie. I am a student of Asian art with a particular love of Korean art, culture and history. I thought this movie borough a very controversial and interesting character to life. Jang Seung-up is one of the (maybe the most) famous Korean artist and continues to be revered as a master. Given the tumult of the time in which he painted and his own conflicted nature, it is amazing that he produced so much work, in so many styles and with such skill.

The revelation here is Lana Turner's dancing ability. Though she was known privately to be an excellent nightclub and ballroom dancer, Miss Turner rarely got the opportunity to demonstrate this ability on film.So, viewers take notice! Here, MGM were clearly still trying to determine in what direction they would develop the still young starlet, and were, therefore, consigning her to everything from Andy Hardy to Doctor Kildaire.In "Two Girls on Broadway," however, she is given an excellent opportunity to display her native rhythm and ability to shift tempo in the lavish production number, "My Wonderful One, Let's Dance."

by TyNesha Mells . In this drama , Ja Rule , who stars as Reggie , struggles with the loss of his wife and baby daughter . I've got to say it. Gary Busey saved this film. If it were not for his fine acting talents this film would have been sub par. I recommend the film but just barely.The biggest difficulty with the film is its broad disregard for historical, geographical and physical accuracy. For example, why is Lubbock green and hilly? How come Buddy's producer Petty ignored? Where are the daily trips to the Clovis, New Mexico studio? Why is Nashville treated as a racist hate camp out to destroy the Holly sound?

I remember this film of old . It 's a great , chilling , atmospheric horror picture about a man who finds out that he is not really a man . I like the scene with the dead bird . When did the old man ( Mr. Brenner ) found out he wasn ' t really a man ? Or did he found out he ' s not really a man when he found the skeleton of a man that he was before ?

The Buddy Holly Story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink, and that’s as far as Holly’s story starts for the audience. In fact, the film begins with the last show of his tour with the Big Bopper and Ritchie Valens. The audience is given a small amount of background on the singer, who was born in Lubbock, Texas, and raised by a single mother. The first hint of his talent comes when he is singing along with a record while driving his mother’s car, and ends up with the car in a ditch.

Charles Chaplin's 'Shoulder Arms' of 1918 was his longest film to date, though, at just over 45 minutes in length, it was not quite a feature film. With World War One just drawing to a close, many popular entertainers of the time were doing their part to inspire their native troops, and Chaplin was no exception. And so the lovable Tramp went to war! The film begins with the Tramp in training, and the character is hilariously inept at even the simplest military drills, including marching and gun-slinging, much to the disgust of his drill sergeant.

I remember this film of old. It's a great, chilling, atmospheric horror picture about a man who moves into a Scottish castle, only to discover that there are strange goings-on in the corridors at night. And there are even stranger events taking place out back, in Hollywood's most familiar hedge maze. Yes, this is the maze you've seen in every feature-length film that ever involved a topiary puzzle, up to and including "The Shining." But the punchline to this story is about the last thing you would guess. I certainly didn't see it coming.

If you like who-dun-its, you will like this film, considered the best Italian detective story (giallo), Fulci has done.It's not Mickey Spillane for sure. There are scenes designed to disturb anyone.Many would be offended by a local beauty trying to seduce a 12-year-old boy. She was joking, but she was naked nonetheless, and he would have jumped at the chance to jump her bones. She also tries to tempt the local priest.Young boys are turning up missing, and there are several interesting suspects. You have to watch carefully to discover the killer. Can you?

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something `` not human '' is portraying human beings and their way of life; these movies include `` Babe, '' `` Charlotte's Web, '' `` Babe II: Pig in the City, '' and `` Stuart Little.'' This essay will compare and contrast these three films and discuss how they portray human beings and the world around them. Firstly, let's have a look at `` Babe, '' which is a film about a pig who becomes friends with many other farm animals.

This searing drama based on a true incident concerns several ambitious African nationals who decide to temporarily leave their families behind to travel to Britain to work and raise money so that they can build a new future for their families back home. But in England the immigrants are exploited by British employers for their work, and soon discover that it will take much longer than originally expected for them to return home. Born in the Ivory Coast and raised by an African mother and French father, Alain Gomis was educated at the French film school, La fémis.

This film set the standard for all rock biopics to follow. It accomplished this through the energetic performances of the leads, the steadiness of the camera-work (avoiding 'rock-video' clichés that were actually invented for the Beatles in their first two films), tight editing, and a non-judgmental presentation of the star as human being rather than symbol or god (or demon). Yes, there are minor holes in the plot, and incidental details that are a little unnecessary, and there will always be debate between families of those personally involved as to specifics.

i did not read the book. nor do i care to. the movie was a beautiful romance, and i think women will enjoy it. no, it was not a "10" film, but it was enjoyable. women, if your man is bored as mine was, then watch it yourself. hurt is wonderful as the philosophic doctor who delivers a thoughtful monologue on "in love" and "loving. "also, if you like nick cage, he was terrific and funny. i enjoyed watching the developing romance. also, if you like Christian bale -- do see him in equilibrium.

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci's reputation as a director. Too often he's categorized as a no-talented filmmaker, only out to shock and disgust entire audiences with images of pure gore. True, his films contain more explicit filth and sickness as your average mainstream American production, but his films always are of wide range and the plots are gruesomely morbid. Don't Torture a Duckling is yet another story! This film is a pure gem of the Italian shock cinema! I easily dare to call this film a masterpieceit's an old-fashioned giallo that includes all brilliant aspects of genuine horror.

Truly unique and stunning film of Jules Verne 's `` For The Flag '' by the Czech master director Karel Zeman. Set in the South Pole, an airship carrying an international group of scientists to the pole is sabotaged. One of the saboteurs is the ship captain's estranged son. The captain is played by Karel Langer, who is also the star of the earlier ``The Fabulous World Of Jules Verne''. The movie has all the usual Karel Zeman effects, with wonderful miniature work and puppetry of the animals and people. The score is by composer Karel Soucky.

Another go round with the monkey king going west .... sort of.Beginning in the middle of some action the movie jumps around a bit with characters and story lines as if we were meant to see the whole thing first then go back and fill in. It was entertaining though and I liked the way they were able to weave real life events into the script. Not sure if it's because the director was too busy or if it's a lack of money or what but I think it would've been better to keep the focus on a single person.

`` I am ... proud of 'Head ' , '' Mike Nesmith has said . He should be , because it has taken a long time to come up with it , and in some cases it has been a lonely business . Even in a group that has split up , it isn't easy. For a year he has been recording this album of his songs with the same group of top musicians - and he is still not satisfied - and now he is trying to decide which way to go. But it is a good album .

Ah the Outer Limits . I love that show . It was surpremely creepy , or down-right mysterious . I have seen many of those episodes in rerun . I saw the Outer Limits many years ago, but I remember it was one of those programs that scared you to the point where you couldn't sleep without the lights on, especially when you were a kid. But I also remember that the stories made you think, even if they were scary. It is hard to believe that it is still on the air 46 years after its first broadcast.

When the Romulans come, they will not be bearing gifts; no, they bring with them war - war and conquest. As any familiar with this episode know, it is a redux of the war film "The Enemy Below" from the fifties. The obvious difference is that instead of a battleship and a submarine (or an American Destroyer & German U-boat) engaged in lethal war games, it is two starships in outer space. In Trek history, about 100 years before the events here, according to this episode, Earth fought the Romulan Wars.

I think that this short TV series, was absolutely wonderful, and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of everything that was on the screen at the given time. This was by far David Attenborough at his best. I personally thought this was one of the best documentaries in the past decade. This is definitely worth peoples money!I also found the bit about the abyss and deep water the most fascinating and interesting part. It was incredible to find out that the 'Blue planet' team discovered more than 10 new species of underwater life!

In Nordestina, a village in the middle of nowhere in Pernambuco, Antônio (Gustavo Falcão) is the youngest son of his mother, who had uninterruptedly cried for five years. When he is a young man, he falls in love for Karina (Mariana Ximenes), a seventeen years old teenager that dreams to see the world and becomes an actress. Antônio promises Karina to bring the world to Nordestina, and once in Rio de Janeiro, he participates of a sensationalist television show and promises to travel to the fifty years ahead in the future or die for love with a deadly machine he had invented.

This film had about everything one could wish when viewing it originally, at the end of the 1960's decade. It was immensely entertaining, and provided a contemporary view of the many changes which had occurred during that period - and were still ongoing - in terms of the Black Power movement, Vietnam, and the volatile movement which followed the quieter, preceding postwar 1950's.All of this and one of the funniest films, then or now.Viewing it for the second time recently, I was surprised to find it as engrossing as when seen originally.

Years ago when I first read John Irving's The World According to Garp, I was astounded that most of the younger adults with whom I had contact didn't like the book when I loved it. I began to understand that it was an age and experience thing. I experienced somewhat of a déjà vu when reading some of the comments on this site that were clearly written by younger viewers. Fully enjoying Separate Lies is surely an age and experience thing.In this film the viewer sees a seemingly happy upper middle class couple - he a successful lawyer - she the perfect wife of a successful lawyer.

`` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is one of the coolest Italian horror films I 've ever seen , and I am not saying this because of the fact it 's from Italy . First of , let 's talk about the story . Well , it 's kind of hard to sum it up without spoiling too much of it , but the main plot revolves around a young girl who was born without an eyesight . She goes to a local school along with her older brother , who is also not a very bright guy .

`` Live Together , Die Alone '' is divided into three main story lines , and each one of them is focused on the three main characters. First we see Michael ( Harold Perrineau ) being interviewed by some government agents and we find out about the events that led to his surviving the crash on the island . He was on the plane because he got a call from his ex-wife Walt ( Malcolm David kelley ) asking for help in locating Michael . After the crash , Michael was separated from Walt, but eventually he got back to the wrecked plane and found him.

An interesting look at the immigrant experience , told as a fable with some very weird imagery.I got drawn to the title because I'm in the midst of writing an immigrant story. I'm also an immigrant to a new country, and this novel resonated for me in so many ways I'd be hard-pressed not to recommend it to anyone interested in the immigrant experience.The novel is narrated in first person, by a young, unnamed Mexican boy, who, with his family, sets out for the United States, where, his mother has been assured, they will be able to make a better life.

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort , and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. The Little Tramp is called back to action in the second installment of this World War I comedy. After the Germans capture his wife (Edna Purviance), Chaplin’s Tramp rescues her with the help of the U.S. army, and then enlists himself in the war effort. As in the first installment, Chaplin’s Tramp is at his best, using his wit and charm to outwit his foes and make the most of his situation.

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci 's reputation as a director . Too often he 's been considered just an exploitation artist who had no respect for the craft, and this is just too damned wrong. I think he 's been considered this way because of the fact that he did make some very exploitive horror films for many years and he 's been compared to other exploitive Italian horror directors from the 60 's - the likes of Bava and Mario Bava (though he never really got as much praise as they did.) But Fulci wasn 't exploitive like them.

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode, THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best episode of the series. And, while I have always loved A PIECE OF THE ACTION because it is so much fun, I really do have to cast my vote as this Romulan episode as being the very best.The movie, interestingly enough, is really like a WWII submarine movie in that it bounces back and forth between the cloaked Romulan ship and the Enterprise as it seeks to destroy the Romulans before they sneak back across the Neutral Zone after a raid on Federation outposts.

I can't get this flick off my brain. It's definitely totally different than anything that's out there. I've seen a ton of movies over the holidays and while some are okay nothing really rocked my world the way BlindSpot did. There is just something way cool about the actors and the way that they put the film together. It's like there is really scary stuff mixed with with some pretty f****ing hilarious black humour. Franco is great but the older rough dude steals the show in a few scenes, like when he punches the kid out in the dirt grave.

We saw La Spettatrice last night @ the Chicago International Film Festival & we were both immensely moved by it. This is a haunting tale of loneliness & missed connection in which the longing for intimacy conflicts with our fear of revealing too much about ourselves to another. The three leads (Barbora Bobulova as Valeria, Brigitte Catillon as Flavia, Andrea Renzi as Massimo) are all excellent and the dynamic between them is very surprising. After all the movies which devalue older women, it's wonderful to see Flavia (who is a law professor at a university in Rome) presented as beautiful & sensual as well as seductive & powerful.

I have to offset all the terrible comments. I love this movie. I own the movie and the soundtrack. I watch it whenever I need a pick me up. Granted it's not like the Sound of Music but it's as much fun if picking at movies is not your thing. I adored the late (and great) Bobby Vann, and James Shigeta has always and will always be a favorite. I saw this when it first came out in the theaters. I'm a big musical fan and this one is 100 times better than Twiggy in "The Boyfriend".

Based on a William Faulkner short story , Two Soldiers is a top notch short film , a movie that is worth every second of it's running time . There is not a lot of dialogue and most of what is spoken by the two actors is in Spanish . The story revolves around the relationship between two soldiers who are on a mission in Mexico during the time of the Mexican revolution . One of them is on his way out , and while the other is young and full of optimism . The two main characters here are fantastic .

Jeff Garlin's film is filled with heart and laughter. As in Curb Your Enthusiasm, his screen persona is hilarious; but in addition we get to see both warmth and a sense of emotional vulnerability that makes the story universal. While the film chronicles his character's dreams of love, performing success, and weight loss, it will appeal to anyone who dreams of a better life. The supporting cast brings the frustrations and joys of his life to the screen in funny and heartbreaking ways. The simple joys of food, friendship, and trying once again once life has disappointed us are all themes.

Yes, at times "Unconditional Love" overwhelms as it bounces -- no, as it ricochets -- from one story element to another in the most unconventional use of thematic elements and characters. In fact, it wasn't until I watched the film for the second time that I began to understand what I think P.J. Hogan might have been attempting to do with this quirky, unconventional flick. Perhaps the entire film itself is a metaphor for the unconditional love for which Grace (Kathy Bates) yearns and describes in the later part of the film.

Accepted is a 2006 teen flick that stars the guy from the mac and PC ads . The movie is about this kid who gets dumped by all the Ivy League schools. He gets admitted into this lesser known college where he thinks his dreams are over. He meets a bunch of other misfits who have also gotten rejected by the same colleges. They decide to start a secret society, only they call it an “accepted society” which is basically a society of outcasts. They have a series of misadventures and of course in the end they succeed in everything.

After learning that her sister Susan is contemplating divorce , Kate decides to travel to the distraught woman 's remote, seaside cabin, where they will reconnect and talk about their marriages. But upon arriving, Kate is dismayed to discover that Susan has already left, and a man named Peter has taken refuge from a storm there. Kate and Peter strike up a friendship...and soon find themselves growing closer...
Peter is a charmer. There's a lot to like about him. Kate and Peter don't know each other. Their first meeting is because of the weather and they end up talking.

Garlin outdoes himself as writer-director-actor in his indie production about a big guy ( Garlin ) wandering around Chicago with his pal in tow. He's unemployed, uninspired, unkempt, unhappy— and unconcerned about any of them. But Garlin gets a little help when he decides to befriend the 5-year-old kid of a recently divorced friend. They're both lonely and sad, but with a kid around to keep him company, Garlin rediscovers the joy in life. Garlin's comic timing is dead-on throughout, while his performance is subtle and understated.

When his elderly mother Emily (Jeanne Bates) is attacked by her lodger Nestor Duvalier (Brion James) and turns into a cannibalistic monster, TV news reporter Clay Dwyer (Mark Thomas Miller) struggles to keep dear old mom from satisfying her hunger.Although the above plot summary conjures up images of trashy, over-the-top, 80s horror titles such as Flesheating Mothers and Rabid Grannies, Mom actually turns out to be a refreshingly original take on the werewolf/vampire/zombie mythos (exactly what Emily becomes is never really clear, but it ain't nice!

The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family's journey from the Old World (Italy) to the New World (America). Salvatore, a middle-aged man who hopes for a more fruitful life, persuades his family to leave their homeland behind in Sicily, take the arduous journey across the raging seas, and inhabit a land whose rivers supposedly flow with milk. In short, they believe that by risking everything for the New World their dreams of prosperity will be fulfilled. The imagery of the New World is optimistic, clever and highly imaginative.

I saw this movie when it first came out in 1973 and loved it . Since then I 've searched for it to watch. Finally found it today and it is just as great as when I first saw it . It is a movie that I can and do watch several times a year. It is so good in that you can watch it and discover new things every time. I highly recommend this movie to any one and everyone. I enjoyed this movie. I think it was a good movie. I love this movie and it was very funny in some ways.

Can the intensity of a husband's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime,despite betrayal on many levels? Tom Wilkinson is no brutal Othello, in the setting of modern day England. So, gradually a web of deceit begins to be woven. And, we witness cycles of jealousy and drunkenness and guilt and fornication. And so the web of "separate lies" begins to fail and then hold together again. And life (and death) goes on, despite the bright flame of the husband's love and the deep despair and guilt woven into so many lives.

What can I say about the series dubbed the NEW OUTER LIMITS...Hmm.... Only that this was one of the best TV series ever assembled!! You have actors of all ages, The actors that are somewhat known and that time forgot. Everyone playing their part to exact perfection! These shows always have some type of moral story to them which most of the time (if not all the time) is very true! You can feel that the man whose voice is dubbed over the credits and in the beginning and ending believes what he is saying wholeheartedly!

I just can't understand why people are surprised this movie makes no sense. It was never supposed to make sense. (Duh! The writers were completely wasted on Frodis at the time.) It was just supposed to entertain and mock, and it does both wonderfully.The Monkees are good actors. They wouldn't have been hired if they weren't good actors. Mike has a thing for deadpan and darkness, Micky is the best at sheer psychotic comedy, Davy is a Broadway veteran, and Peter actually had people believing he was that dumb in real life.

inspite of many movies dealing with great artists or a genius , chihaweseon pointed out the real dilemma in which the artist has been caught . The story revolves around Van Gogh - a very talented artist who never made his work public . His work was appreciated only after his life . The story shows the pain of the artist which he was unable to show to his near and dear due to his psychiatric condition . A great movie with a great music . Movies which makes you think and introspect are a delight to watch and the more you think the more you get to know yourself and life .

A mix of 70 's drug humor along with parody of medicine and classic story line . As I 've read the first few pages the book seems to be good and worth a read . The first page itself has a sense of humor and keeps the reader wanting to read more pages . It is quite difficult to get through the initial chapters . I was confused with the way the author writes . But after the initial few pages it becomes a page turner . The book has many twists and turns making it more interesting. There are few parts that can make you laugh out loud .

I was 19 or 20, years old at the time and living in Salt Lake City, Utah and I still remember the new dome theater, called the century 21. Layback chairs that rocked and a new sound system, large screen and huge open space between the screen and the packed theater. We felt all the excitement of a new preview screening of a film. Ta da da daa da ta da dada dada... I can still hear the opening music ringing trumpet and the crash of cymbals. I loved the interplay of characters and the filmed vistas.

Oh my word!! I have never seen a film so lacking in any kind of moral judgement or consideration for anything other than the death of the scum! Michael Winner here makes a valid observation of human desires in displaying a gung-ho troth world of deep and damaged execution. Not only does he spoon feed us with utter hell on earth seen through the face of the moustached Bronson, but he also shows us the spoon he's feeding us with and says "look at what your watching now look at your self and ask the question: Are you enjoying this?"

I admit to being in awe of the Sea and have spent a number of years in the Navy, so I am somewhat biased on this one. I missed this documentary when it first came out but nagged various people to buy me it on DVD this Christmas (2002) and I got it! Some of the film is amazing and I have a lot of respect for those who make these kinds of documentaries, to see 200 ton Blue Whales 'cruising' through the Sea is an incredible sight, they looked like submarines.

To say the truth , I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor . However, the movie was very nice , especially the ending was beautiful . What makes a movie a masterpiece ? I believe that a masterpiece is more than an average movie , it’s something unique that will stay in the spectator’s mind for ever , it’s like a dream . In my case , I will never forget about this beautiful movie . I watched this film in a language I don’t know, so some parts were a little bit confusing .

Chaplin is a doughboy in his final film of 1918 , a doughboy who can not seem to get the attention of his beloved. He does not care for the film itself but he likes the fact that he finally is the lead in a film which he wrote and directed. I think it should be noted that Chaplin was one of the only stars that did not go over the top to get the public's attention. He didn't try to get out of the army and he didn't go on stage tours when the USO did them.

This is a stunning movie. Raw and sublimely moving. It felt like a very gripping, intelligent stage play (but without the overly theatrical feeling one actually gets from watching people on a stage) which plays on everyone's terror of a white lie escalating to monstrous consequences. All of the main players are mesmerising. Tom Wilkinson broke my heart at the end... and everyone else's judging by the amount of fumbling for hankies and hands going up to faces among males and females alike. Julian Fellowes has triumphed again. He's a national treasure.

Dr. Paul Flanner (Richard Gere), a successful surgeon, has his wife leave him, his son (an uncredited James Franco) not respect him and looses a patient he's operating on. Adrienne Willis (Diane Lane) has two children and discovers her husband has cheated on her. They both need to get away. She watches over a beautiful oceanside inn in Rodanthe at the same time he books a room. They're all alone together. You can pretty much figure out the rest.This is what's known as a weepie or a woman's film.

This is a funny movie . The Bob & Eddie Show feel of it could lead to a sequel but I am glad it was not one of those movies . It's a feel good movie . Went to see this and it wasn't that great of a film . The only saving grace was Chris Pine. I did like the scene where he was a waiter at a wedding . That was good. But everything else about it was just plain dull. The best movie i saw at the cinema in the 2010's decade. It's funny but also has a good plot with some drama.

Coming from the "druggie" generation, I thought this movie was hilarious. It definitely brought Jekyll & Hyde up-to-date, so to speak. My husband and I laughed all the way through it. Would love to have the movie in my collection. I told my two teenagers about the movie and they would love to see it. They aren't into drugs but they know enough about them to understand the comedy in the movie. It's been so long since I've seen it I can't remember but a few things.

It took me a while to find this movie since they don't have it yet on DVD (and my VCR is not worth hooking up again). I guess all the referencing to drug use is too much for some folks. But I found a decent bootleg on Ebay and I must say that anyone who takes this movie too seriously is just retarded. It is a slap stick spoof in the vein of "Airplane." I must say that when I watched it on Showtime or Spotlight growing up in the 80s, I enjoyed the humor a whole lot more then, than I do now.

I do n't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor . You need it , then fine . But please keep it to yourself . I know that you will find it difficult to understand this but NOT EVERYONE HAS THE TIME TO BE A COMEDIAN ! It is not a requirement or a condition to be human , and I will tell you WHY :
If you do n't get it , that's fine . Don't try to be a comedian because you do not need to be . It's not necessary .

Not a stunner , but a good movie to see once or twice . Bill Macy shows he can do more than a comedy . This is a great story and very entertaining. I had not seen this movie in a few years, and I loved it still. I love movies with great casts, and this one is not an exception. A very well-made movie. Not great, but has a certain charm that kept me interested to the end. Great cast, but I felt they were a little wasted. A great movie that isn't shown nearly enough anymore.

Nominated for best documentary feature at 2004's Academy Awards, My Architect follows filmmaker Nathaniel Kahn in his quest to find out about his father, the legendary architect Louis I Kahn. Lou Kahn died in 1974, when Nate was 11 years old, leaving behind an incredible but limited body of work, unpaid debts and three separate families all living within a few kilometres of each other. My Architect follows Kahn's life through chronologically examining his buildings, and interspersing their beauty with the story of a charismatic, but selfish and emotionally immature genius.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film , like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles , as just another routine cop thriller. Not so ! There is plenty of tension throughout this 1974 movie and a fair share of action. Bronson plays a tough but honest New York street cop who is transferred to Los Angeles after shooting a corrupt colleague in cold blood. There he is put on an assignment of infiltrating a gang of drug pushing hippies, who have in their possession several kilos of high quality heroin and are led by Karen ( Jill Ireland).

My friends and went through a period of time when we would rent movies that none of us had ever heard of. The only good that came from it was this movie, "Take it to Limit" Right as the movie started, we could tell we were in for a true classic. The music is probably done by rural white boys from Colorado, but it sounds just like early 90's rap. The star of the show, actor Leo Fitzpatrick, plays the bad-boy so well, especially sporting a big zit the entire movie.

I thought I might be disappointed viewing this film again after so many years. On the contrary, I was more impressed now than in my callow youth with its honesty and brave humour. In 1969, the transition among African-American groups from a predominant policy of conciliation and integration to one of confrontation and self-determination was still quite new, and more than a little controversial. It took courage and finesse to portray both the Establishment and the Anti-establishment as the caricatures they often closely approximated in real life. Special mention should be made of Arnold Johnson's performance: he successfully avoided having his character lapse into either sociopathy or buffoonery.

Considering all of the comedies with a military situation that have been done in history , someone had to be the last. The final one of course had to be a western and it has a great cast and is well worth watching. Glenn Ford, George Hamilton, James Caan, Arthur Kennedy, Robert Vaughn, John Marley, Andrew Prine, and a long list of other greats make this a very enjoyable film and it has some really good action in it too. I know that Glenn Ford had a great career in westerns and his last one was The Appaloosa , but I like this one better.

I saw this movie on it 's opening night , and enjoyed it . I probably would have enjoyed it a lot more had I not seen it after the first 3 movies in the Jurassic World series . This movie was a little different in that the dinosaurs didn't always seem to be the main target of the bad guys , sometimes it was the main characters instead. I did think the story line was good , it was just the action sequences where they kept changing the story back and forth with the fight scenes that left me confused a couple of times .

I always liked listening to Buddy Holly and felt a real loss when he was killed at a young age. So I can imagine what must have been going through your head when the news was relayed to you. Thank you. He was my first rock star hero. A wonderful and very special tribute. Thanks. This is the best I have read. I was there. I can tell you that this is exactly what happened. Thank you for taking me there. I’d love to see your pictures, too. I don’t know why but this really hit home.

I do n't see that much wrong with this movie . Granted , the principal singers might not be Luciano or Callas , but the rest of the cast is very good . The movie is a bit dated , yes , but so what ? The scenery is pretty and the costumes are nice . If you can overlook a few minor flaws you might just enjoy this one . A really good adaptation of Puccini's great opera. This film adaptation of Giacomo Puccini's "Madame Butterfly" is quite good. It has been well-envisioned and well-directed by Richard Fleischer.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The film captures and interprets his artistic method ('sketching' poems), his inspiration (the spirit of nature and its fantastic beauty) and his struggles to accept a harsh reality in the face of his idealist imagination.The film integrated excerpts of Miyazawa's poems into the plot beautifully. His relationships with his students was powerful, especially in one scene where he offers everything he has to a student who has just been caught stealing materials from the classroom.

This movie gives us some WWII history along with some touching romance , a little fantasy and meaningful emotion - all rolled into a package that is easy to enjoy and well worth the time! It is set during the last winter of WWI, 1918, and is about an unlikely romance between a British soldier and an actress at a London theatre (the real Theatre Royal). The real theatre has been around since 1812 and has hosted a variety of acts from Shakespeare to rock music. It was the home for some of the most famous stage actors of their day including Charles Dance and Diana Rigg.

The movie does n't take itself seriously , and if you follow its lead you 're going to have a good time watching it . The cast is very young , but all the main actors did great jobs , and even the villain in this story was good . The movie is a mix between spy films and comedies . But at the end of the day it 's not a great movie , but it 's one of those enjoyable films that you can watch with your family and friends . A very entertaining action film. I watched it with my brother who was very entertained by it.

When I saw this movie i expected it to be a cheesy American movie done on the cheap with appalling special effects. How wrong was I? This is actually quite a fun little sci-fi movie. There is some terrible CGI, but nothing really that bad and the movie does still have a low budget and looks like it. The story of this movie is quite simple. A ship is flying through space on a routine mission and it comes across a distress call. The ship answers the call, thinking it might be in trouble.

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel,I have to say out of all the shows that I've seen that ADV released,this one is one of the best shows of all time. I had to see it again,and that's when I got my chance. I bought the entire box set of this series at Best Buy for my 20th Birthday. And I got to enjoy it,and see more of the episodes that I missed on Action Channel,and the same 3 episodes that I've seen.

Lucio Fulci made a lot of great films throughout his career and the way that many of them featured a bucket load of gore lead to him earning the title 'The Godfather of Gore'. While Don't Torture a Duckling was made before Fulci became well known amongst gorehounds, and isn't all that gory; it's certainly a gritty and nasty little thriller, and for my money - the best film that Fulci ever made! Don't Torture a Duckling really is head and shoulders above a lot of the Giallo genre in terms of production values and unlike many of Fulci's later films, everything about this Giallo is great.

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film, The Life of Jimmy Dolan which starred Douglas Fairbanks, Jr. as the prizefighter on the lam.Even with the restrictions now upon production by the Hays Office, this remake actually turns out to be better than the original. Douglas Fairbanks, Jr., is horribly miscast as a pugilist. John Garfield with his background and style steps into a part he was born to play.They Made Me a Criminal was directed by Busby Berkeley who Jack Warner believed in keeping busy in between musicals. Berkeley in fact would soon be leaving Warner Brothers for MGM.

I love the TV contest . Hate to see it end . There are so many talented contestants . It was nice that the judges were complimentary and positive about the contestants instead of being mean . I love watching this show every week and am very sad that it has been cancelled. There are so many people out there with talents that they don’t always know they have and this show helps them know they can achieve so much more than they thought! I hope another channel picks this up soon so we all can watch it again as I hate to miss out on the next season of this show.

What a shame this movie was never released. (It is now playing on cable.) I tuned in based on my high regard for the stars and was rewarded by seeing a movie far better than the ones I've been paying to see in theatres recently. I like to be surprised. So often movies are marketed as "offbeat," but are in fact more of the same old recycled drivel. This movie is genuinely different, with the bonus of a heartwarming message. Jonathan Pryce sings like an angel.

The cover of the VHS says it all : `` Without doubt , the most powerful movie of its kind !``
The movie begins with a narrator talking about the story of the 70's (and 80's) underground fanzines that were published all over the world and that had in common the idea to oppose the mainstream media, to question the consumerism of today's society by promoting countercultures and alternative ways. The first part of the film takes a look on the fanzines themselves by interviewing people that were involved in fanzines and collectives. After that, the interviews begin to be mainly focused on music.

This movie is an awesome remake of the original by the same title. The movie was cool,despite the fact, I hate new ones! All of the cast was awesome . It has great cast and an awesome plot!! The main plot is a man is poisoned and he has to solve his own murder , neat eh? !Dennis Quaid is the man who is "D.O.A"(in other words Dead On Arrival).He finds help with his friends, but everyone is now a suspect! !Dennis's character has several hours to find out who poisoned him.

My favorite show of all time! Yeah, I thought this was so cool, and Larisa Oleynik was the first crush I ever had (AAAAWWWWWW). It was well written, funny-except when it it wanted to be serious, and just a great show overall. But since we couldn't afford to keep Nick, I couldn't see any episodes after Feb. 1996, and maybe that makes me think more of the show than I should. To me it's more the epidemy (now that doesn't look spelled right!)

Being a middle aged mom myself, I very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown-up people that weaves in the many issues that effect us. Diane Lane beautifully portrays Adrienne and the sacrifice and conflict that a mother goes through, wanting to do what is right for her children, but still have a happy life herself. I am not a big Richard Gere fan, but he always does a good job with the guy who is sort of jerk, but learns something about himself.Criticism of their romance as unrealistic is hardly justified when compared to most other romantic movies.

Jack , Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond . His traumatic past experience has come back to haunt him , he is very upset that the boat was taken by Locke and Jin . Jack tells him about the Dharma food drop and they decide to go and get it . Jack tells Sawyer about Kate's pregnancy and Sawyer says that he has always had faith in Kate's ability to look after herself . He reminds Jack that he's the one who has always told him to "let her do her thing " and now he's not doing it .

This is a stunning movie . Raw and sublimely moving . It felt like a very gripping , intelligent stage play . And the performances , the music , the set designs , the cinematography , the lighting , the makeup , all were first rate . There is nothing not to like . The only problem with the film that I found is that it could have been tighter and had more of an ending . I felt like some things weren't tied up and just sort of ended . But , I loved it . I can't stop thinking about it . 9.3 / 10 .

If you 've never experienced the thing that is Zasu Pitts , here is a Zasu zinger ! In 1933 , MGM , as part of the studio's series of all-star revues , had a film called Hollywood Party , which featured , amongst others , Jimmy Durante , Joan Blondell , Glenda Farrell , Franklin Pangborn , The Three Stooges and Zasu Pitts . Zasu played a maid and the only thing she did was to fall down the stairs ! When you see that fall , you will know exactly what she did ! I saw this movie when it came out on VHS , in the early 80s , I think .

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character , unable to speak , living in a world incompatible with modern life. The film , directed by Jean Becker, with a script by Olivier Assayas and Jacques Fieschi , is set to be released in France on May 29. A new film , from 28 to 30 April, will be the subject of the film “Don Quixote ” starring Gerard Depardieu. The film was shot in Catalonia (Barcelona, ​​Sitges, ​​Tarragona) and is based on Don Quixote , with some modern elements .

While I agree that this movie lacks any real substance and should not be taken seriously, its primarily directed to fans of the series who are looking for a quick fix. Bronson (Paul Kersey)once again takes to the streets (given a license to kill by the chief police no less) and moves into his friends apartment (who you guessed it) was killed by a street gang that has taken control of the neighborhood (which looks like Beruit). It's funny that people who associate with Bronson have a habit of getting killed.

After a somewhat slow start I thought this movie about the Italian occupation of a Greek island during World War II would be all about the islanders and their heroics but, as the title indicates, this is more concerned with the soldiers who occupy the village. I'm not quite sure that the two sides are evenly balanced as it seems as though the Italians are a bit on the stereotypical side but that's only because they're so funny. I'd have loved to see more of them because they were all so great.

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from! For once she was bang on! What a superb film! First of all I was convinced James McAvoy & Romola Garai were Irish so convincing were their accents; and by half way through the film I was utterly convinced Steven Robertson was a disabled actor and pretty sure James McAvoy was also! When I watched the special features on the DVD and saw both actors in their 'normal' guise, to say I was blown away would be an understatement!!!

I saw this movie on late night TV out of Buffalo about 30 years ago and I 'm dying to know what the name of the movie was. It was a low budget movie but it was very good and it was about a guy that woke up one morning and found himself buried in the ground in a coffin with only his hands sticking out. I know, I know I know its a crappy description but its all I have. If you have any information on the name of the movie I will be eternally greatful. I have looked everywhere and I have found nothing.

Truly unique and stunning film of Jules Verne's "For The Flag" by the Czech master director Karel Zeman.Although the story is enacted in a rather understated late Victorian style, the visuals are a knockout. Zeman uses animation, graphics, painted sets, model animation combined with live action to create the atmosphere of Verne that the reader associates in his mind. The style resembles the steel engravings of Dore and Bennet and Riou that illustrated these stories with a healthy dose of Georges Melies added.Photographed in beautiful black and white the animation is of the highest order and not of a Saturday morning variety.

If you haven't seen this film, do it. Its a genremix as i've never seen another. Some very surreal scenes, some hilarious funny stuff, a film noir felling, musical numbers with a swing, sex scenes (The 2nd best played orgasm on Film, bested only by Sally), a pitch of Orson Welles blended together into a work of art. As an work of art it hasn't to be logical at the end, at least not logical for everybody ;-). I owned an tv copy on VHS but loaned it to an ex-girlfriend and now i can't get it back.

A beautifully photographed and paced short film . It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the feeling of the area. A family of four live happily together with their dog in a lovely big home. But the man of the house dies and leaves behind his young widow and children. He is mourned. But slowly his presence becomes a ghostly reminder of the lives they have led and the changes that must take place. The mother and the children must adapt. But she is not ready. She sees him in her home, at his fishing spot, out at work.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji , a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the 1900s. It follows a fictional account of his youth, his life as a teacher and his sudden death through an imagined journey of his mind. We meet the younger Miyazawa living with his family in 1903 on the island of Shikoku. He has an uncanny ability to sense when the tides are high as well as a sense of awe of the elements, which leads to a strong sense of connection to nature.

This is one of the best of the early "Star Trek" episodes, with Kirk and his crew venturing into the unknown to do battle with an enemy known only by name. Imagine their surprise when they find out that the dreaded Romulans are racial offshoots of the Vulcans! Young Mr. Stiles, well-played by Paul Comi, is one of the few truly unlikable characters in the "Star Trek" universe. His barely disguised hatred of Mr. Spock is eerily similar to the post-9/11 hatred and suspicion many Americans have of people of Arab or Middle Eastern origin.

This was a riveting film , one that really drew me in . I 'm a big fan of William Hurt and this was a perfect fit for his talents . It was a well made film that was interesting from start to finish . I saw this movie a few months ago while I was visiting my parents for the weekend. I had seen the first trailer for it, but I really had no interest in watching it. After my sister and her boyfriend suggested it, I figured, why not give it a try. It turned out to be pretty good.

I just had the opportunity to see 'Nuovomondo ' ( hitherto known in the U.S. as 'The Golden Door ' ) and was impressed. It's directed by a newcomer, Italian actress Emanuele Crialese, based on a story by Maurizio Casagrande. I watched the Italian version subtitled in english, and noticed that there were 2 differences between it and the English version: in the U.S. version, there are some additional scenes, which do not affect the storyline, and also, the title is different. The Italian title means New World, whereas the U.S. title means Golden Door.

Duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner 's mansion in Paris. When a little boy and girl from England arrive to stay with the Duchess' owner, everything changes. The little boy and girl are sent off to school and the Duchess is left to look after the mansion, but when the Duchess and her kittens realise they can sneak off to play with the little boy and girl, a whole new set of mischief begins. But will Duchess find her way back to the mansion before they are caught?

1930 's comedy mystery about `` The Crooked Circle '' a band of hooded crooks who set about plotting the perfect jewel heist. 1929 musical drama about the rise to fame of a young girl in London's Soho district in the 1920s. 1940 's wartime drama based on the true story of V.C. heroes during the World War II. 1951 adventure thriller about a British spy who has been trained to withstand the worst that torture can inflict. 1954 adventure drama set in Victorian England, telling the true story of the ill fated balloon expedition of Dr. John Harrison.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon . I loved the film from the moment I saw it and it stayed with me over the years as one of my favorite movies. I've always wanted to write about the story but never did until now that I've retired from my career. The story, which is still relevant and timely today, resonated with me as a metaphor for how we deal with the stresses and uncertainties of real life today and how we can better cope with our problems.

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol ' says it all . I used to watch this movie when I was like nine and ten . I loved it ! It was so cool . I used to imitate Tina when we played . She was my favourite . I remember my dad giving me a hard time about it . He used to say , " Why can't you make up a movie instead of watching this one , every time ? " I'd be like , " Why ? This is the best movie ever ."

This was the greatest movie I have ever seen in my life , the action was great , and i loved that the movie was set on the beach , it was really good , you should watch it , and tell me what you think. Awesome storyline that follows the book pretty closely which was a nice touch. The ending is not the same, but you will understand what I mean by watching this movie. I am going to give this one 5/5. I have watched it twice so far! This movie is very good.

Coming from the `` druggie '' generation , I thought this movie was hilarious . It definitely brought Jekyll & Hyde back into the mainstream . You don't have to be a sci-fi fan or a comic book nerd to find this movie appealing . The plot of the movie revolves around `` Mr. Hyde '' & how he goes around the world and takes all the drugs in the world to make himself strong as well as evil . He then comes to New York and starts killing people as well as stealing their brains . He wants to harvest the drugs in their brains and make himself even stronger .

Well, what's wrong with the title "Separate Lies" (accused elsewhere of not being "exciting"). It's cunning, subtle and a bit poetic. (Of course there's a Phil Collins song and a James Belushi film called "Separate Lives", which are alluded to here.) But the real point is the ethical dilemmas of telling lies at different levels that the film probes. OK, it's not an "in-your-face" hilarious title, but then it's not an in-your-face hilarious film. Please give British films like this a chance.

Between sweeping, extraordinary scenes within a plethora of Indian locations and a plot which is Bollywood inspired yet grounded in reality, this highly moving film is a must-see for those who love a good romance/adventure. And by this, I mean "good", not a Hollywood or Bollywood easy and contrived happy ending. East meets West in a different take on the buddy film.
