In fact it beats out his later movies hands-down. This is a tale of superstition and suspicion in a small Italian town out in the middle of nowhere, where young boys are dying mysteriously. It's no mystery how they died, I guess, it's more who's doing it. Is it a woman that the townspeople have always considered a witch?

The movie doesn't take itself seriously, and if you follow its lead you're going to have a lot of fun (as long as you don't mind your murders served up really bloody, and your horror topped with extra cheese)!This film winks an eye at every horror fan, and then gives them the finger. It knows it sucks, and because of that, it's far and away the best of the "Child's Play" series. It plays up the "stoopid humor" angle so well, you find yourself doing more than just laughing AT it, but WITH it.

This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house . . . It was a good movie, as far as Disney flicks go. I LOVED IT!!!! I thought they did a great job with the movie. They kept a lot of the songs but added some new ones too. I thought they did an amazing job with it and I'm super excited for this movie! It's my favorite movie of all time!!! I really enjoyed this movie. Meryl was great in it and I just loved it.

At first I did n't think I would like this movie , but as it progressed it became better and better . I was impressed by how they portrayed the main characters feelings in the movie . They did a good job on all the cast of characters . A must see for teens . It is a comedy , so don't take it too seriously . I'm sure everyone has had a feeling like they were in the movie , so I don't think anyone will dislike this film . Great job ! This was the perfect movie to go see with my 16 year old.

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn 's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architect father. Kahn designed the Salk institute and was responsible for the master plan of Dacron. He was very involved in urban planning at a time when the modernist utopian ideal was being challenged. One of the big questions the film explores is the tension between architecture and environment and the effect that a building has on a community. It is interesting to see what happened to the places Kahn lived and built as the decades went by, and how the inhabitants of the buildings felt about their surroundings.

Great movie . Post-apocalyptic films kick ass . This one is no exception . Kept up the pace and interest from start to the end. The acting was decent. The story has a lot of plot holes which is expected from a 1970's cheesy low budget sci-fi B-movie. The special effects were pretty impressive for a low budget movie of that time. The sets were good too . Some people might find it too corny , but that's just their problem . Very Good SciFi flick from the 1970's with a lot of great elements.

Great show! About time a reality TV show comes along that closes generation gaps. Contestants range in ages, some seem old enough to have watched the movie when it first came out. And others, looked so young that perhaps parents or teachers handed down the movie hoping it would touch their lives the way it once touch them. Grease has truly become an American icon. Grease is a fun and entertaining movie in which the young and old can relate to. "You're The One That We Want" is sure to gain even more Grease followers.

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread . Louis de Berniere's 2004 novel, Corelli's Mandolin, is a charming book about a Greek island community that is turned upside down when a British officer billets with a local woman. The movie of the same title from 2001 (which I'd never seen) was pretty much panned. But as I watched, I was reminded of what I liked about the book. The scenery of a Greek island looks so lush, the people so open.

Let me clarify that. This is not a "good movie", but I am so glad it is out there, I am so glad I saw it, and for the role that it plays in my DVD collection, it is sublime. It is the ultimate PG-13 romp, it is college as we imagine it will be when we're freshmen in high school, it requires so much suspension of disbelief that it may as well be taking place on Mars. It is so wholesome that even when it tries to be dirty it wouldn't make your grandmother uncomfortable.

In Tweety's S.O.S, Sylvester goes from picking garbage cans to being a stowaway on a cruise ship that happens to carry a certain canary bird-and Granny, his owner. Uh-Oh! Once again, Tweety and Granny provide many obstacles to the cat's attempts to get the bird. Sylvester also gets seasick quite a few times, too. And the second time the red-nosed feline goes to the place on the ship that has something that cures his ailments, Tweety replaces it with nitroglycerin. So now Sylvester can blow fire! I'll stop here and say this is another excellent cartoon directed by Friz Freling starring the popular cat-and-bird duo.

Considering it's basically low-budget cast, this is a surprisingly good flick about the life and death of rock pioneer Buddy Holly. Gary Busey stars as Holly, who was one of the first to use an electric guitar for pretty much all his music. Backed up by his Crickets, Holly had a string of hits and became a bona fide star before his death in a plane crash along with Richie Valens and The Big Bopper. The film follows his rise to stardom, marriage to his sweetheart and eventual death. I like this film and believe that you will too.

This movie felt so real. I actually felt all of the emotions portrayed here during my life at various times - that of both Rory and Michael. I have Duchene's Muscular Dystrophy like Rory so what you see here is exactly what I've actually felt myself. Some won't believe there ARE disabled people like Rory, full of anger and rebellion. I know they exist because I'm one of them.The story is great. For a drama, character-driven movie, the story moves fast. I was never bored, maybe partly because I was seeing stuff that is close to my heart.

I hope , from his seat on Heaven 's comedic throne , Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this , I'd really like it if he could . I wonder , as I've had a few in my time , what a good Irish whiskey , drunk with his good mate Peter Sellers , would have felt like . I know what it felt like , but I'd like to imagine what it would have felt like , through Spike's very funny glasses . I've not been a great fan of Milligan for a long time .

I usually give horror films around 6/10 , but this one caught my eye . House of Wax was by Warner Bros (1941) , directed by Freddie Francis , and was a remake of 1933 movie. It is very good film , with brilliant special effects . This movie will make you scream with fright . It is so scary , you will want to hold onto the person next to you for comfort . There are some scenes that will make you cover your face . This film has all the best scary horror scenes .

Loved today 's show ! ! ! It was a variety and not solely cooking ( which would have been fine too ) ! ! ! Even when she is having trouble cooking or baking , she still keeps the show fun ! Love this gal ! Have her books and watch her on Food Network too ! I like the show when she travels to different cities for the weekend. I wish she did them more often, like one every two weeks. When she is at home, I don't find her as much fun, but that's just me.

It reaches the minds and feelings of everyone driving them deep in the black desert. A brutal but beautiful world that is explored through memories and edgy layers of sound and score. The landscape develops its own persona, paralleling the inner geography of all three characters as their stories unfold. The stark void of lost love, the fear of the unknown, and then transcendence of emptiness through the very openness of this desolation. Three misguided souls fighting to find something absolute and positive in all that negative space. The drama is compelling. James Franco and his co-stars deliver deft performances.

I hope, from his seat on Heaven's comedic throne, Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this film, as Terence Ryan and Ken Tuohy have taken a book that the author himself said writing it "nearly turned me mad" into a joy to watch.The film tells the story of the Irish town of Puckoon and the problems befallen upon it when the partition between Northern Ireland and the Republic is drawn up, cutting its way through the centre of the village and, more worringly, through the middle of the churchyard.

This was the greatest movie I have ever seen in my life, the action was great, and i was so scared, there was a lot of gore WHICH MADE It GREAT, i would see it 1,000 more times, and Paris Hilton, D*MN she fine in that movie. But anyway, i would recommend it to anybody, even kids(like me) Adults like it to. You would probably have nightmares at night though, but beside that, IT IS AWESOMe, I CANT STOP BRAGGING ABOUT IT.

I will admit , I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film , and after about 5 minutes , I shut it off and deleted it out of my iPod . I never felt compelled to see the movie again . The reason for this , I had no interest in seeing this film . It was an action film , not a comedy film , it was not horror film , nor was it a thriller . It was just a film I had no interest in . I will admit , I did not have to watch this film for my blog .

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange . I was confused , sad and happy . The sadness comes from the fact that this movie is based on true life events and this story happened . This made me sad . The happy moment came when he decided to move on and forget everything about his wife . The confusion in my head was on the fact that he decided to move on and marry another lady , this was the confusing part for me . But then , I came to understand that this was for the best .

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film ( which is excellent ) . It borrows heavily from that film but changes many of the details. What the film does have is one of the greatest screen performances I've ever seen - that's Richard Attenborough as "Chief Bromden" who won the best supporting actor award in 1975. The rest is good too with Gene Wilder also giving a fine performance. The DVD version has an interesting "making of" and commentary which is good. A great movie to watch with the family.

This is probably my favourite TV show ever . I love all the characters , especially Alex , who is so cool . So sad there are only two seasons . I would watch season 7 for a really long time ! I love this show, it's a very good series. Very funny show and it's only two seasons. I miss it a lot. I hope they'll create more shows like this. This should be higher up on the list! I love it so much that I'm actually writing a review on it. The show is brilliant and the actors are brilliant.

Little Gus is a ten year old delinquent. He runs away from his parents and decides to go on a road-trip. Reaching the petal is somewhat tough for him, so he creates a device to help him. His goal is to win a gimmicky lottery type card game called Motorama. He has to find all eight letters in order to spell M-O-T-O-R-A-M-A. Dark laughter follows as it turns into the road-trip from hell. He runs into some deranged Lynch like characters. Most memorable is the gas station attendant, who puts his picture on a kite in hopes that God will see it.

I was n't expecting a great deal from this film , so I was pleasantly surprised when I watched it for the first time today on the telly . I had never even heard of it but I think it was pretty good . The main actor is a young guy called Edward Norton , who is a really good actor . He's the one who gets all the best roles and he can carry a film . He's really good as the main bad guy in American History X for example and he won an Oscar for Primal Fear , where he's the main lead .

This is another film where the cinematography is the best thing to recommend it. That would be fine if the film were a travelogue, but as a dramatic exercise in cinematic artistry, that is not good enough. The theme of inter-species respect and co-operation ventures timidly into the forbidden world of inter-species love, but its approach is stereotypical, indicating a lack of understanding of the behavior motives of either species. As with many films, one always wonders what could have been achieved by a more innovative director and a more creative screenwriter. Alas, we probably will never know.

In Nordestina , a village in the middle of nowhere in Pernambuco , Antônio ( Gustavo Falcão ) is the village’s most beloved citizen. For more than 60 years he worked at the same company, and he has been the president of the Workers’ Association for 30 years. One day he is fired, and he takes it like a bad joke. But soon, the seriousness of his new situation sets in and he must deal with the new world in which he finds himself, in which the rules change and the meaning of success and wealth have nothing to do with what he has always believed.

This movie is great I really enjoyed it.This movie is about a cat mom named Dutchess and her 3 kittens.Turbo is one of the cat's kittens.Then one day turbo get's sucked into a race car .And he becomes fast.He goes in 3 races.He wins all of them.He becomes a superstar for racing.At the end of the race his dad gets him and he goes home with his mother and brothers. My favorite part was when turbo came from the bottom of the race and got sucked into the race car. I like this movie because I like animals.I would rate it 5 stars because it was really cool.

First off, I absolutely loved this movie. As a Billy Crystal fan, I must say that I was expecting more comedic situations than I actually got. However, it was nice to see him in a role with more depth and emotion. His portrayal of talent agent Sammy was brilliantly performed and uniquely him. In addition, Gheorghe Muresan (as Maximus) was superb in his first film role. When Sammy goes to Romania to visit his client on location he has his world turned upside down. He never expected that he would accidentally find the one person who could change his life.

The Child's Play series isn't a favourite of mine, but Bride Of Chucky is actually an okay movie. This time we have two dolls Chucky and his former girlfriend (when he was human) Tiffany. Together they go on a journey to find an object. There are a few interesting scenes through the movie like the guy getting hit by the truck and literally exploding, the sex scene between Chucky and Tiffany and the ending which allows for another sequel to take place. Wasn't really a straight forward horror, it mixed a lot of comedy and was a sort of spoof of the horror genre.

Head should have been a proud moment not just for its stars ( The Monkees and Victor Mature ) , its director ( Jack Nicholson), its writers ( Robert Getchell and David Merrick), but the Hollywood system in general. Head is the first movie ever to be entirely funded by its stars' residuals and advances on other films. For decades Hollywood had operated on the assumption, based on no real evidence, that audiences would only pay to watch a film if that film was financed by a major studio. Head was the first to test that notion.

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC . I 've been looking for it ever since . It was a wonderful movie . I am a big Robert Mitchum fan . It has to be one of his very best . I would very much like to buy it if you can find it . Mary, please visit the link below to see a list of Robert Mitchum's films available. http://mitchumfilmcollection.com/mitchum_film_collection.php
We hope that you find what you are looking for. I watched a very old movie on the TCM channel and they said that they do not have permission to release it.

This is my favourite Columbo . Martin Landau ( excellent ! ) plays twins , one of whom may have killed his brother . The script has more than a touch of the Hitchcocks about it , with some genuine surprises . I won't give the plot away , except to say I was genuinely gobsmacked by how it ends , but I defy anyone to have guessed it . I've been watching and enjoying Columbo for 40 years now , and I'm still surprised by how many I haven't seen - this is easily the best one of those I've missed .

OK so Paris Hilton sucks in it (typical Malibu Barbie) but the rest of the actors are just great! I watched the film last night and it totally kept me going thru out the whole film. Chad Michael Murray IS SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO HOTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT and he's just a ace actor. Total hero man. The main girl who is the sister to nick (chad) is such a brilliant actress. Thumbs up. I think it's so different to films out their these days, most of them to go with psychopath's, possessions, ghosts but here you have a theme about wax!

A great movie . The movie was even better then the commercials put on . And believe it or not I was a little disappointed when it was all over . I wanted it to keep on going but I guess you can't get much better . I loved the whole idea of it . And I think we would have seen more of it . If the people that wrote it and made it would of had their way . And of course if it was made today . There would be less violence . And that would take a way from it .

I do n't usually comment on films since I am in the movie distribution business , but I have to comment on your excellent review. I have to comment on your review. As for me, I usually don't comment on films, but this is my favorite. As for me, I usually don't comment on films, but I have to say that this one's my favorite. Thank you very much for your useful comment. It was really useful for me. The commentary in your book is really valuable. As I mentioned before I was impressed by the commentary, too.

'Captain Corelli 's Mandolin ' is a fantastic film in itself . It is nothing like the book , which is a great disappointment . However , the movie is very well put together . The cinematography , the music , and the characters all add up to an excellent movie . The book , however , is even better . The movie cuts out many of the most important elements of the book , which is sad . The book deals much more with the relationships between the villagers and the soldiers , and has much more to do with the war and what the war did to people . '

As many of today 's movies are guilty of , the plot is n't exactly stellar , the movie does have its merits though , first of all the visuals are very good the movie makes very good use of it's budget and the visual effects and action scenes are pretty good considering the budget , and the movie is fun in parts , and has some really funny moments . I was surprised to find that this film was written and directed by the guy who wrote "The Terminator" (1984). I'm also surprised that there are no reviews for this movie on IMDb yet.

When the new Outer Limits first started , the episodes were quite optimistic and challenging . As the series began to wind down, the shows were darker and more morbid. The show ended up as a 2 part episode. The final 6 shows were in the new series format, with the original opening and closing. The first show was about time travel. In 2021, a man goes back 25 years to 1986 to try and prevent a murder, but instead he gets caught in an accident and his life is saved.

I've commented once on this Chucky great, but I had to do it again to say some things about the film, when I first saw it in a great balcony in a great theater. The film was a lot of fun in the theater and my first Chucky film ever in a theater, and that was a special moment for me, because I cherish Chucky. The other horror villains are referenced with GREAT COOLNESS!!! And the gore was shockingly great! The scene where the gay kid gets nailed by the truck was amazingly cheerful!

I agree that this is ONE of the very best episodes of the entire series -- my only detraction would be I didn't think the story was as well-told as others have been in this series. Still, an awesome episode. The scene of Buffy and Angel walking down a sun-drenched street in Los Angeles was pretty great, too, and I'm not sure it would have made as big an impact if it didn't follow this episode. Reactions: puppies
The scene of them walking in sunny LA is so great.

SPOILERS BELOW`A Dog's Life' was most noteworthy for its excellent comic timing. In Charlie Chaplin's other movie from 1918, `Shoulder Arms', the silent film genius focuses on an entirely different brand of humor. His war comedy specializes in surreal, exaggerated set pieces in which Chaplin demonstrates unprecedented creativity and mastery of composition. When the soldier's bunker gets flooded, the water level reaches just the right height so that Chaplin can execute his gags most successfully. In a later scene, the soldier dresses up as a tree, a disguise that belies Chaplin's much increased ingenuity and goofiness.

( Some spoilers included : ) Although , many commentators have called this film surreal , the term fits poorly . There is no other way to explain the film than as being realistic , and not in the traditional sense . One reviewer has gone as far as saying that it was a piece of crap , and that the reviewer wasted money and time watching the film. That is definitely not the case here . This reviewer has seen some surreal films in his life and this is , by far , the most surreal and disturbing film that this reviewer has ever encountered .

There's no point in comparing this with the original series. Though different in look and content, both are true to the original idea. That is, an SF/horror anthology series. Due to indifferent scheduling in Australia, I've only managed to catch a small number of episodes spread over the first few seasons. The very first episode really did give me the creeps (nightmares at my age ...!) but a number of others did fall flat; generally when the stories moved into horror realms and away from SF. I only hope the DVDs reach us eventually.

it 's a good watch if u have time - deals with three friends who get into a needless barfight which results in them having to escape to the country to hide out, but it is not long until one of the fighters in the brawl who was not supposed to be there turns up. he ends up killing 1 of them and chasing after the other two. its a pretty slow moving story and some of the camera work is terrible, there are some good scenes and nice atmosphere. i'd recommend this only to the completists as not a lot happens and it takes a while to get going.

Really, This movie should be released to DVD. I just got a bootleg copy of what I think was a studio film and I was utterly pleased!!! It was on my list of films to own simply because of the cast. Three of my PEOPLE, Michael York, Olivia Hussey. Both having been in Romeo & Juliet, and also John Gielghud. sorry about the bad spelling, were in there so on that alone I thought that for the small amount I was spending it would be fine. Boy was I right.

Like a few people I know, I came in late on 'Stingers'; not until 2000. Three years later there is no way I'd miss an episode. The show really is that good and has, for a better word, maintained its integrity, unlike 'Blue Heelers', for example. The crime is the thing; personal lives are there but only wheeled out when affecting an investigation! When Gary Sweet was brought in, some fans seemed worried, but he's really fitted in well, which didn't surprise me.

The Aristocats is really quite charming , and is rated far too low on IMDb . The songs are n't the best Disney has ever done but they are all lovely . I'll agree with that and add that, of all the sequels to a "classic" animated film, I'd have to say that this is the one I'm most excited to see in 2017. I don't know if it would have made more money in 1981, but I think people would like it just as well today. I know I'll be in theaters watching it this summer.

I loved this film ! ! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it ! ! I was not disappointed in this film at all. I am so glad that it came out that way ! I think I cried a little during the last scene. It was so sad yet beautiful. It is so true that the world needs to hear this story. I will buy this film to add to my library. I am looking forward to reading your book. I will let you know when I read it because I will be sure to write a review !

William H. Macy always gives a good performance. He never looks lazy and never seems like he'd rather be somewhere else. In short, he's what more actors should be like. "A Slight Case of Murder" is directed by Steven Schachter, who went on to do two more great films with Macy (Door to Door, The Wool Cap).Television movies have long been a dump of overdone acting, poor cinematography, and sub-par scripting. That's why it's so refreshing to see a TV movie that does exactly what it's sort of film was created for.

What a great film ! I never knew much about Buddy Holly , but was familiar with his lively and melodic music . I really enjoyed seeing and hearing the story behind it . I would recommend this to anyone . Wild , fun , crazy , sad , unfortunate . I loved it ! This was such a funny and enjoyable movie . It had a great sound track and the actors were very talented ! I loved it , it was a really great movie that made me want to learn more about this period of American history . This was a good movie , not the best but very entertaining .

When I was 10 ( currently 14 ) , I vowed to never see a movie that I knew would get an R-rating and I never have until a few weeks ago and that movie was the new Batman vs Superman film. You may have heard it's rated PG-13 and is supposed to be an R-rated film so I went in thinking it wasn't actually going to be very violent. I wasn't very impressed by the movie but the part that I was most surprised by was the amount of swearing that went on in the movie.

It's Showtime! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro's careers. It's an entertaining movie and a guilty pleasure but not quite up to the actors' standards, especially not Robert's. Showtime is directed by Tom Dey and features some small roles from guys like William Shatner and Mos Def.Showtime is about two very different cops, Mitch Preston (DeNiro) and Trey Sellars (Murphy). One takes work seriously in a low profile, quiet manner while the other is more easy-going and wants to have more fun than felons in his back seat.

(Synopsis) Graduating high school senior Bartleby "B" Gaines (Justin Long) finds himself without a college to attend. He has been able to talk and con his way out of every problem he encounters, but he hasn't been able to charm his way pass the college admissions board of eight colleges. His mom and dad are very disappointed that Bartleby hasn't been accepted into college. His parents think that if Bartleby doesn't go to college, he will have no future. Several of Bartleby's friends are in the same situation of being rejected by all the colleges they applied to.

The "all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring..." scene was a riot. I also guffawed at the scene in the bar where Hyde snorted the horse radish and flipped the bird to the Japanese guy and said "Pearl Harbor buddy". I think my IQ is higher than 115, but I'm not sure because I can't count that high.Funny thing, this 10 line requirement. Seems as though they would bash you for making your comments too long, not too short. I hope I don't make it to 1,000 words before I get to line 10.I'm still two lines short.

I had the chance to watch Blind Spot in Barcelona and I enjoyed it tremendously. I thought it to be one of the most captivating movies that I'd seen for a long time. One of the best points of the film was to meet new fresh faces and great actors behind them in unexpectedly and brilliantly filmed great locations. The three heroes share a chemistry on screen that runs all across the film making it so thrilling. They are set on outstanding landscapes spotted by such an original eye (the DOP's work is just great) that makes you feel like you are discovering them for the first time.

A beautifully photographed and paced short film. It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the country during the period just prior to and after Pearl Harbor.I appreciated the visual look of the film -- naturalistic and simultaneously poetic. Great work by a great D.P., David Boyd.Though a family film, the story never becomes maudlin or saccharin. We understand and believe the motivation that propels the young boy on his odyssey. I understand the love of the younger brother for his older brother and do not question why he sets out to do what he does.

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans. Okay I'm sure it's not as good as what the Child's Play movie were like, but this can get really funny and enjoyable, Chucky's laughs are hilarious. (SPOILERS)Now not one doll, but two, meaning double the impact, Jennifer Tilly played the part really well and definitely pulled off the best kill of the movie.If you have seen the Child's Play movies this would be a worthy film on your Chucky collection, but if you've never seen the Child's play movies before, this'll will be a new start.

A Formula For Murder is n't a well known Giallo , but that is n't to say it 's not a good one, it's a really good one, with a strong plot that keeps you gripped to the end. I have to admit to not have heard of it before, but once I'd found it I was impressed by the quality. I have to say I much prefer these Giallo 's to the more mainstream Giallo 's, the reason being that they are very dark and twisted in a way that the more well-known aren 't.

Not sure why the other comment on this film was so negative , but I loved this movie . I’m going to see it again with a friend who is also going to see the first one with her son , and I can’t wait for that . To each their own but this movie is a 9 out of 10 for me . I just loved it!!!!!!!!! Having just come from seeing this movie I can’t help feeling extremely disappointed in what was presented on screen. The trailer was so exciting and filled with intrigue.

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat ! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the cast of this play which is set in London in 1969 when homosexuality is still considered a crime, the film was a joy to watch. I am a big fan of Emily Watson and have been ever since Gosford Park when I realised that she has the ability to carry an entire film on her own. Rupert Everett does a good job in the role of Maurice, a respectable professor of Classics at Cambridge who has suppressed his true sexuality because of his family.

Considering it 's basically low-budget cast , this is a surprisingly good flick about the life and death of rock star. Even if they don't seem that good actors , the guys manage to give the movie an authenticity that most of the movies on this theme are missing . And the songs are good too , especially when the band is playing live ! I've seen much better music biopics but it's still a pretty decent movie that I recommend ! Rock and roll is about sex, drugs, and a little bit of Rock and roll .

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode , THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best first season episode of TOS. It had great characterization and a taut script. I think it's one of the only episodes that was actually filmed at Vasquez Rocks park, too! I am glad they did not make another series of Twilight Zone but rather this show. I really like this show. It is kind of like the new Outer Limits. This show is one of the best sci-fi shows I have seen and I like it better than the new Outer Limits.

Gary Busey did a splendid job playing the rock-n-roll legend Buddy Holly ( 1936-59 ) . He does have a resemblance to Holly , but I think it's his outrageous style that made me think that the movie was more of an entertainment than a documentary. But I don't want to complain , because this movie does have it's moments that are very true to history . Buddy Holly's career was short in duration but he managed to make a lot of great songs that are still heard today. I'm sure that he would be surprised by his popularity today , especially with the younger generation .

Due to its predictable , second-rate title , ( the one it was distributed under in Italy , at least) it’s quite easy to dismiss Tinto Brass’ The Howler as a typical exploitation flick , but it’s actually quite better than most of the genre . The Howler is not a film for the faint-hearted, and if you’re offended by sexually-explicit films, you might want to avert your eyes here . It’s not quite the hardcore smut it was marketed as, though, and the sexual content is certainly no more extreme than what you’ve likely already seen .

This is sweet. The actress who played the nurse with the gonzongas is the same actress who plays Elvira mistress of the dark. Another little tidbit is the actress who played the nurse who would give her wedding ring was the landlord lady of Roy Munsin in King Pin. This is most glorious story ever to be told. It should sell more copies than the bible. My parents played a part in suggesting the release of this movie to a local movie theater. The movie ran for a week and we were one of 4 families to see it.

Indeed , Cynthia Watros is in this movie as Elizabeth talking to Desmond . Though I 'm just wondering how come I didn't recognize her , when I usually do , since she is in so many things that i have seen . I have no idea as to why , but I do think it is one of her better performances in recent years , if you like to see her doing something other than ER or the Practice . I have not seen it all yet so that is not the only reason why I think it is good so far .

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film , The Life of Jimmy Dolan (1933). It stars Bonita Granville as a girl who is falsely accused of a crime and who goes to prison. Also in the cast are Peter Lind Hayes as a newspaper reporter who is on her side, Kent Taylor as her boyfriend, and Edward Norris as the prison warden who tries to help her. What's it about? The story is about a small-time hood who finds himself framed and thrown into jail. When he escapes, he decides to find out who put him behind bars.

What a shame this movie was never released . ( It is now playing on cable . ) I tuned in half way through it . I was very disappointed , not because of the quality of the film but because I never even knew this existed. It is so strange that a movie like this could be released today and yet in 1968 they could not get it into the theaters . I loved the 1973 version of "Cabaret" , but this movie is even better . I watched the 1973 one last night and then watched this one . It is a very different movie .

Remember that this came out before Gulf War I , which gave us Werner Herzog 's `` Lessons of Darkness ,'' an eerily similar documentary that explored the desert's strange beauty and also its capacity for utter destruction. I know that I may not be the best person to review `Alien', because I am a big fan of the series and of the original `Alien' movie in particular. It was one of the first movies that I saw on video as a child and it had a profound impact on me.
